title: Canadian Dollar Slips as Liberals Head for Only Narrow Victory
content: Canada’s dollar weakened against the greenback on speculation Mark Carney’s Liberal Party would achieve only a narrow election victory.

title: AB Foods Reports Profit Dip With Sugar Unit Slow to Recover
content: Associated British Foods Plc reported a 10% decline in adjusted operating profit due to a loss at the British conglomerate’s sugar business.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 04/29/2025 (Video)
BP Slashes Its Buyback as Cash Flow Plunges and Debt Rises
content: BP Plc cut its quarterly share buyback to $750 million, right at the bottom of its target range, as plunging cash flow and rising debt called into question the company’s financial resilience.

title: Trump's Auto Tariff Reprieve & Carney's Liberals Win Canada Election | Daybreak Europe 04/29/2025
content:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is projected to win the nation's election, after a campaign dominated by President Donald Trump's tariffs. Carney's Liberals are on track to win enough seats to form at least a minority government. President Donald Trump is set to blunt the pain of tariffs affecting the auto industry, with a lifting of some levies on foreign parts for cars made in the US. 

Meanwhile, most power has now been restored in Spain following a massive electricity outage across the country and in neighboring Portgual. 

Today's Guests: Volvo cars CEO Håkan Samuelsson & Deutsche Bank CFO James von Moltke (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Google Parent Alphabet Kicks Off Sale of Debut Euro Bonds
content: Google parent Alphabet Inc. is looking to raise at least €2.5 billion ($2.8 billion) from a debut euro bond sale on Tuesday, just after selling $5 billion of debt in the US.

title: China Vows to Stand Firm, Urges Nations to Resist ‘Bully’ Trump
content: China’s top diplomat has warned countries against caving in to US tariff threats, Bloomberg's Minmin Low reports. As the Trump administration hints at the possible use of new trade tools to pressure Beijing, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said appeasement will only embolden the "bully." This comes as Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says it’s up to Beijing to take the first step in de-escalating the tariff fight with Washington due to the imbalance of trade between the two economies. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China Says Willing to Cooperate With US After Boeing Spat
content: China is willing to support normal cooperation with US companies, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said, just days after Chinese airlines rejected taking delivery of any new jets from US planemaker Boeing Co.

title: Woodside Gives Final Nod for $17.5 Billion US LNG Project
content: Woodside Energy Group Ltd. made a final investment decision on a $17.5 billion liquefied natural gas export project in the US, cementing the Australian company’s position as a top supplier of the super-chilled fuel.

title: Gold Falls On Stronger Dollar as US Offers Auto Tariff Reprieve
content: Gold declined on expectations President Donald Trump will ease the impact of his auto tariffs, weighing on haven demand amid hopes of a further dialing down of trade tensions.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 4/29/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Turkey Banks Find Cheaper Long-Term Debt Despite Tariff Turmoil
content: Turkish banks are set to borrow at the longest maturities on the syndicated loan market in nearly a decade, with some investors seeing slower inflation partly offsetting global uncertainties caused by President Donald Trump’s tariff plans.

title: Stocks Advance on Auto Tariff Reprieve, Gold Drops: Markets Wrap
content: Asian stocks rose to the highest level in a month on expectations President Donald Trump will ease the impact of his auto tariffs, boosting hopes for further dialing down of trade tensions.

title: China Copper Market Gauge Hits 16-Month High on Demand Flurry
content: A gauge of strength in China’s copper market has jumped to the highest since late 2023 as buyers scramble to secure supplies.

title: Oil Extends Drop as Trump’s Trade War Pummels Outlook for Demand
content: Oil extended a drop as the global trade war hurt the outlook for demand, with data pointing to signs of strain in the US economy and China stepping up its pushback against the Trump administration’s tariffs.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 04/29/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Avril Hong and Haidi Stroud-Watts give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks on Best Winning Streak Since 2017
Deutsche Bank Debt Trading Hits Record on Market Volatility
content: Deutsche Bank AG’s trading unit hit a record in the first quarter as the lender benefited from market volatility.

title: Oil’s Rarest ‘Smile’ Fascinates Morgan Stanley as Glut Looms
content: The global oil market is in very rare territory right now, with futures pricing that points to near-term tightness while also flagging a “meaningful surplus” further out, according to Morgan Stanley.

title: Neves: Etihad Doesn't Need Cash From Possible IPO
content: Etihad Airways is ready to go public whenever shareholders decide, but don't need the cash from the IPO now. That's according to the airline's Group CEO Antonoaldo Neves who spoke to Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on their growth outlook & new aircraft deliveries.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ECB’s Kazaks Hopeful That Step-by-Step Rate Cuts May Continue
content: The European Central Bank should be able to carry on with gradual interest-rate reductions, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.

title: ADB: Tariff War Shows Asia Needs New Trade Partners
content: Masato Kanda, President at the Asian Development Bank, says Asian countries should diversify their trading partners and boost domestic demand to ensure they can ride out the current global trade war. He speaks with Shery Ahn on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bonds in India Rally as RBI Adds $15 Billion More OMO Purchases
content: Bonds in India rallied after the monetary authority announced a $15 billion debt purchase for May, a move which will significantly add to the cash surplus in the banking system.

title: Only in America — 100 Days of the Anti-Reagan
content: How Trump 2.0 is stacking up against other presidents — and even Churchill.

title: Several ECB Officials Want Fewer Banks to Face Direct Oversight
content: Several top euro-zone officials want to exempt more lenders from European Central Bank oversight as part of efforts to simplify banking regulation, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Italy's Valentini On Trade War Impact on Italy, EU
content: Italian Deputy Minister of Enterprises and Made in Italy Valentino Valentini discusses the trade war, impact of tariffs, deepening of trade relations between Italy and Asia, plus investment opportunities. He speaks with Haslinda Amin on "Insight with Haslinda Amin." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Evergrande Chair Refuses to Disclose Assets, Liquidators Say
content: China Evergrande Group Chairman Hui Ka Yan plans to refuse disclosing details of his assets, its liquidators said, likely complicating efforts to wind up the defaulted builder to pay back creditors.

title: China's Consumers Are Not Boycotting US Brands: Goldman's Cheng
content: Chinese shoppers remain rational and are avoiding large-scale boycotts of American products despite the enduring US-China trade conflict, according to Goldman Sachs. However, US and multinational brands still face headwinds due to the growing brand imprint of domestic Chinese consumer items, Goldman's Co-Head of Asia Consumer Research Michelle Cheng tells Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Citic Sees ‘Turning Point’ for China’s Steel Industry This Year
content: China’s steel industry is expected to see a “turning point” this year on additional stimulus measures and production cuts, even as overseas tariffs put pressure on demand, according to Citic Securities.

title: Discount Chain Eco-Shop Seeks $97 Million in Malaysia IPO
content: Malaysian discount retail chain Eco-Shop Marketing Sdn Bhd plans to raise 419 million ringgit ($96.7 million) in what will be Malaysia’s biggest market debut in eight months.

title: Canadian Dollar Slips as Liberals Head for Only Narrow Victory
content: Canada’s dollar weakened against the greenback on speculation Mark Carney’s Liberal Party would achieve only a narrow election victory.

title: Spain Slowly Returning to Normal After Crippling Blackout
content: Spain and Portugal were returning to some semblance of normality early Tuesday, with many questions remaining about what caused one of Europe’s worst blackouts in years across the Iberian peninsula the previous day.

title: Pakistan Shoots Down Indian Spy Drone in Kashmir, State TV Says
content: Pakistan’s army shot down an Indian spy drone along their disputed border in the Kashmir region, the state-run television channel reported.

title: China Vows to Stand Firm, Urges Nations to Resist ‘Bully’ Trump
content: China’s top diplomat warned countries against caving in to US tariff threats, as the Trump administration hints at the possible use of new trade tools to pressure Beijing.

title: China Says Willing to Cooperate With US After Boeing Spat
content: China is willing to support normal cooperation with US companies, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said, just days after Chinese airlines rejected taking delivery of any new jets from US planemaker Boeing Co.

title: Carney’s Narrow Victory Buoyed by Voters in Toronto, Montreal
content: Canada’s Liberal Party held onto crucial ground in the Toronto and Montreal regions, helping secure a path for Mark Carney to remain prime minister even as support slipped from the last federal election.

title: Carney’s Liberals Win Narrow Victory in Canada’s Election
content: Canada’s Liberal Party is projected to win a fourth consecutive election, giving a mandate to former central banker Mark Carney after a campaign in which he pledged to boost economic growth and stand up to US President Donald Trump in a trade war.

title: Tariff War Shows Asian Nations Need New Trade Partners: ADB Head
content: Asian countries should diversify their trading partners and boost domestic demand to ensure they can ride out the current global trade war, the head of the Asian Development Bank said.

title: UK Considers Breaking £2 Billion Aid Promise to the World Bank
content: The UK is considering scaling back its nearly £2 billion ($2.7 billion) commitment to a World Bank fund for developing nations, according to people familiar with official plans, in a move that could see it slash aid alongside Donald Trump’s White House.

title: Hong Kong Activists Released After Years in Prison Under Beijing-Imposed Law
content: HONG KONG (AP) — Four former Hong Kong lawmakers were freed from prison Tuesday after serving more than four years for their convictions under a Beijing-imposed security law that crushed a once-thriving pro-democracy movement.

title: Zombie Ships Are Fast Becoming a Feature of Venezuelan Oil Trade
content: On Good Friday, an aging supertanker fully laden with oil and calling itself Varada arrived in the waters to the east of Malaysia after a two-month voyage from Venezuela.

title: Trump to Offer Auto Tariffs Reprieve After Carmaker Appeals
content: President Donald Trump is on track to ease the impact of his auto tariffs, with changes sought by the industry that would lift some levies on foreign parts for cars and trucks made inside the US.

title: Canada Election Live Results 2025
content: Track Canada's electoral seats, districts, and key battlegrounds in real time

title: Pakistan Minister Warns of ‘Immediate Threat’ of India War
content: A top Pakistan defense official warned of the possibility of war with India but said it can be averted, as tensions rise over last week’s militant attacks in the northern region of Kashmir that killed 26 people.

title: Japan Worries Trump Tariffs Will Push Countries Toward China
content: US President Donald Trump’s tariffs could push Asian nations closer to China and destabilize regional security, Japan’s ruling party policy chief warned, calling for stronger defense ties between Washington and Tokyo.

title: Harvard Probed by US Agencies for Law Review Discrimination
content: The Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human Services announced investigations into Harvard University and the Harvard Law Review citing reports of race-based discrimination, broadening the government’s assault on the oldest and richest US university.

title: Deepfake Revenge Porn Bill Heads to Trump for His Signature
content: The US House on Monday passed legislation to crack down on the proliferation of AI-generated non-consensual pornography, also known as deepfake revenge porn, sending the bill to President Donald Trump’s desk for his signature.

title: Bessent Sets July 4 Tax Bill Goal as Economic Worries Mount
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent set a July 4 goal to pass President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax cut package as polling shows that voters largely disapprove of the White House’s handling of the economy.

title: Iran Dangles ‘Trillion Dollar’ Incentive for Trump in Deal Talks
content: As countries around the world try to bargain with US President Donald Trump over tariffs, longterm adversary Iran is pitching its sanctioned economy to him as an investment opportunity.

title: US, Mexico Reach Key Water, Screwworm Deals Ahead of Trade Talks
content: The US and Mexico reached two key agreements for the agricultural sector on Monday, smoothing over conflicts that threatened to escalate tensions between the neighbors amid trade negotiations brought on by Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Tracking the Highs and Lows of Trump’s First 100 Days
content: Tariffs, trade wars and executive orders. On today’s Big Take Podcast: Breaking down the breakneck speed of President Trump's first 100 days.

title: Trump’s China Attacks Are Unleashing Wave of Nationalist Support for Xi
content: Even critics of the Chinese leader want him to stand firm in the face of an unprecedented economic attack.

title: Nvidia, Eli Lilly Among CEOs to Tout US Investments With Trump
content: Chief executive officers from Nvidia Corp., Johnson & Johnson, Eli Lilly & Co., General Electric Co. and SoftBank Group Corp. are among corporate leaders slated to visit the White House on Wednesday as President Donald Trump highlights the US investments they’ve announced in the first 100 days of his second term in office.

title: Carney Promises to Strengthen Canada in Victory Speech
content: Voters enter a polling location during a federal election in Calgary, Alberta, on April 28. Photographer: Gavin John/Bloomberg

title: Trump’s First 100 Days and What’s Ahead on Tariffs and Taxes
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Spanish Blackout Drags Into Evening as Power Slowly Returns
content: The worst blackout to hit Europe in over a decade dragged on into Monday evening across much of Spain and Portugal even as Spain’s grid operator gradually restored power to parts of the country.

title: Macron Urges Trump to Take Firmer Line With Putin Over Ukraine
content: French President Emmanuel Macron believes the US is open to ramping up sanctions against Russia after he urged Donald Trump last week to get tougher with Vladimir Putin, he said in a Paris Match interview released on Monday.

title: Trump Predicts Hegseth Will ‘Get It Together’ Despite Controversies
content: President Donald Trump said he thinks embattled Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth will “get it together,” telling the Atlantic he’ll stick with his choice to lead the Pentagon despite recent turmoil.

title: Putin’s Brief Ukraine Truce Frustrates Trump Plan to End War
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared a new temporary ceasefire in his war on Ukraine to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory in World War II, drawing criticism from the US as it seeks to negotiate a peace deal.

title: Australia’s Economic ‘Miracle’ Is Ending No Matter Who Wins Vote
content: The two main candidates are pitching contrasting visions to an electorate seeing living standards decline

title: Not So Slick
content: Get briefed ahead of your morning calls with the latest UK business headlines, key data and market reaction

title: Adidas Says Trump Tariffs ‘Put a Stop’ to Boost in Targets
content: Adidas AG held off from boosting its financial guidance for the year on concern over US tariffs, which will raise prices in the world’s biggest sports market and could upend the German brand’s momentum.

title: Lufthansa Says Earnings Visibility Limited Amid Trade Spat
content: Deutsche Lufthansa AG cautioned that it has only limited visibility into the latter part of the year as trade tensions and changing consumer behavior throw the global economy into disarray.

title: BBVA First Quarter Earnings Beat Estimates on Tax Saving
content: BBVA SA posted first-quarter profit that beat estimates as fee income, trading performance and a lower hit from Spain’s bank windfall tax aided results.

title: AstraZeneca Gets Profit Boost From Diabetes, Cancer Drugs
content: AstraZeneca Plc posted higher profit in the first quarter, driven by sales of its diabetes and cancer medicines.

title: Carlsberg Volumes Decline on Soft Spending, San Miguel Loss
content: Carlsberg A/S saw volumes decline in the first quarter, due to the loss of a key contract to produce San Miguel beer in the UK and a soft consumer environment.

title: Rheinmetall’s Sales Surge as Europe Builds Up Defense Capacity
content: Rheinmetall AG’s military sales soared 73% in the first quarter, as Europe’s increased defense spending drove up orders for the manufacturer’s armored trucks and weapons.

title: ‘Miracle Economy’ Loses Luster as Australians Head to the Polls
content: Good morning, it’s Amy in Melbourne with your Tuesday newsletter. Today’s must-reads:• Our so-called “miracle economy” faces headwinds • Our AAA sovereign credit rating may be at risk, S&P warns • Lynas Rare Earths in talks with Trump administration

title: China Says Willing to Cooperate With US After Boeing Spat
content: China is willing to support normal cooperation with US companies, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said, just days after Chinese airlines rejected taking delivery of any new jets from US planemaker Boeing Co.

title: Carney Says Canada's Old Relationship With US Is Over
content: Mark Carney, speaking in Ottawa after his Liberal Party was projected to win a fourth consecutive election, said Canada's old relationship with the US is over, and that the nation has "many, many other options than the United States to build prosperity for all Canadians." Carney, a former central banker, campaigned on standing up to US President Donald Trump in a trade war. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Novartis Raises Forecast After Profit Beats Estimates
content: Novartis AG raised its outlook for the year after profit beat estimates in the first quarter, driven by medicines for breast cancer, multiple sclerosis and psoriasis.

title: Russia’s Temporary Ukraine Truce Frustrates Trump
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared a new three-day ceasefire in Ukraine to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory in World War II. The truce will start on May 8 and end at midnight on May 10. The Kremlin’s announcement was met with disappointment in Washington as White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said President Donald Trump wants a permanent end to hostilities and is “increasingly frustrated” with the leaders of both Russia and Ukraine. Bloomberg’s Tony Halpin reports.

title: Deutsche Bank Well-Positioned Amid Volatile Markets: CFO
content: Deutsche Bank Chief Financial Officer James von Moltke discusses the lender’s performance amid recent market turmoil and US trade policy upheaval. Deutsche Bank’s trading unit hit a record in the first quarter with its fixed income and currencies business recording a 17% revenue jump to €2.9 billion ($3.3 billion) in the three months through March. Von Moltke talks with Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Europe: Carney Wins In Canada (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 17:50

title: Spain Slowly Almost Back to Normal After Blackout
content: Spain and Portugal are returning to some semblance of normality following one of Europe’s worst blackouts in years across the Iberian peninsula the previous day. Spanish power supplies were back to nearly 100% capacity at around 7 a.m. in Madrid. Bloomberg’s Rodrigo Orihuela reports.

title: Carney’s Liberals Win Narrow Victory, Spain Blackout Latest

title: American Airlines, JetBlue End Talks to Revive Tie-Up Pact
content: American Airlines Group Inc. said it’s ended discussions with JetBlue Airways Corp. to revive a pact for the two airlines to team up again.

content:
Is your Shein cart looking pricier than usual? The fast-fashion giant has hiked prices for US consumers as much as 377%.

It’s an early sign of the potential effect of Donald Trump’s trade war on American buyers. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Entain Names David Permanent CEO After Isaacs’s Swift Departure
content: Entain Plc said Stella David, who had been serving as interim chief executive officer, will take on the position at the UK gambling group on a permanent basis.

title: Alphawave Extends Deadline for Qualcomm Bid as Talks Continue
content: Alphawave IP Group Plc said it has extended the deadline for Qualcomm Inc. to make a firm bid for the London-listed semiconductor company until May 12 to give the companies more time to discuss terms of a potential deal.

title: HelloFresh Earnings Triple as Efficiency Program Bears Fruit
content: HelloFresh SE said first-quarter earnings more than tripled as its efficiency program started bearing fruit.

title: Sony Weighs Chip Spinoff That Dan Loeb Called for Years Ago
content: Sony Group Corp. is considering spinning off its semiconductor unit, according to people familiar with the matter, marking the PlayStation maker’s latest effort to streamline its business and focus on entertainment.

title: Deepfake Revenge Porn Bill Heads to Trump for His Signature
content: The US House on Monday passed legislation to crack down on the proliferation of AI-generated non-consensual pornography, also known as deepfake revenge porn, sending the bill to President Donald Trump’s desk for his signature.

title: Chinese Tech Firms Credit Ratings May Be Upgraded, Muzinich Says
content: Some Asian technology companies with credit ratings on the lower end of investment grade may be upgraded within the next two years as they seize on artificial intelligence growth, a portfolio manager at Muzinich & Co. said.

title: Three Abu Dhabi Giants Plan Stablecoin Backed by UAE’s Currency
content: Three major Abu Dhabi entities, including a sovereign wealth fund, plan to launch a stablecoin fully regulated by the central bank of the United Arab Emirates and backed by the dirham, a move that could speed the Persian Gulf nation’s efforts to adopt digital currencies and facilitate payments.

title: US Weather Agency Risks Loss of Data Network and Web Service
content: A key contract that supports the network service provider for the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is set to lapse this week, threatening internet access and the transmission of internal data nationwide for much of the agency.

title: Alibaba Rolls Out Latest Flagship AI Model in Post-DeepSeek Race
content: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. took the wraps off a new version of its flagship Qwen AI model, sustaining the breakneck pace of development that’s characterized China’s artificial intelligence sphere in the wake of DeepSeek.

title: NXP Announces New CEO, Warns of ‘Very Uncertain Environment’
content: NXP Semiconductors NV announced a new chief executive officer as part of its quarterly earnings report and warned that the chipmaker was navigating “a very uncertain environment” due to tariffs.

title: Google Parent Alphabet Leads US High-Grade Issuance Rush
content: Companies including Alphabet Inc. sold more than $18 billion of high-grade bonds on Monday, the most in one day since March, the latest sign that debt markets are stabilizing after the turmoil brought by tariff announcements early this month.

title: IBM Pledges $150B US Investment, Apple Shakes Up AI Unit | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses IBM's plans to invest $150 billion over the next five years in the US. Plus, Palo Alto Networks’ CEO joins on the company's latest acquisition. And FPV managing partners, Pegah Ebrahimi and Wesley Chan, talk about finding startups that outlive the AI hype and withstand an economic downturn. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: UPS in Talks With Startup Figure AI to Deploy Humanoid Robots
content: United Parcel Service Inc. is in talks with robotics startup Figure AI Inc. to use humanoid robots for some tasks in the logistics giant’s network, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: OpenAI Lets Users Go Shopping With ChatGPT, Challenging Google
content: OpenAI now lets users shop for products within ChatGPT, the latest move by the artificial intelligence startup to expand the reach of its popular chatbot and challenge rivals like Google.

title: Washington State Tax Hikes Target Tech Giants That Made It Rich
content: New taxes passed in the final days of Washington’s legislative session seek to bridge a record budget deficit by shifting more of the tax burden to technology companies like Amazon.com and Microsoft Corp.

title: Musk ‘Super Fan’ Eyes Texas Shift for $110 Billion MercadoLibre
content: MercadoLibre Inc., Latin America’s most valuable company, is asking shareholders to approve a plan to move its domicile to Texas from Delaware amid a wave of firms reconsidering the long-standing corporate haven after a public spat between a judge and Elon Musk.

title: UAE Data Center Firm Plans Saudi Push After Silver Lake Deal
content: Khazna, a data center developer in the United Arab Emirates, is planning a major expansion in neighboring Saudi Arabia as the oil-rich nations compete to power the artificial intelligence boom.

title: Big Tech’s Earnings Problem Is Estimates May Be Way Too High
content: The last time Big Tech delivered earnings, Donald Trump had just started his second term, stocks were soaring on expectations of a pro-growth agenda and investors’ main worry was how long it would take companies to convert their artificial intelligence spending into profits.

title: Thiel-Backed Fintech N26 to Offer Mobile Service to Boost Growth
content: N26, the Peter Thiel-backed German neobank, is planning to offer mobile phone contracts to customers as it seeks new avenues for growth, copying a strategy that its larger competitor Revolut introduced last year.

title: IBM Plans to Invest $150 Billion in US Over Next Five Years
content: International Business Machines Corp. plans to invest $150 billion in the US over the next five years, joining a cohort of companies that have announced spending commitments following President Donald Trump’s election and tariff threats.

title: AI Startup Nscale Chases ByteDance Deal and $1.8 Billion in Debt
content: Nscale, a startup that is less than a year old, is already trying to raise about $2.7 billion to build artificial intelligence infrastructure on the back of a pending partnership with ByteDance Ltd., the Chinese owner of TikTok, according to an offering document seen by Bloomberg.

title: Deliveroo Shares Jump After $3.6 Billion DoorDash Offer
content: Deliveroo Plc shares surged by more than 18% on Monday, the most since 2021, after the British delivery firm disclosed an acquisition offer from DoorDash Inc.

title: Zepto Founders’ Special Situations India Deal to Yield 16%
content: The founders of Indian quick commerce company Zepto Marketplace Pvt. are planning to raise 15 billion rupees ($176 million) in a private credit deal that will offer investors as much as 16% yield, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Intel CEO Targets Change in Corporate Culture to Shape Up
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King looks at the issues confronting Intel Corp.’s new Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan as he seeks to turn around the chipmaker’s fortunes.

title: Canva-Backer FPV Ventures Raises New $525 Million Fund
content: Wesley Chan, a former investor at Felicis Ventures, has raised a new venture capital fund along with Morgan Stanley alum Pegah Ebrahimi — bringing in $525 million for the second investment vehicle at their firm, FPV Ventures.

title: TDK Adds Risk Scenario to Downbeat Outlook Due to Tariff Threat
content: TDK Corp.’s revenue outlook fell well short of analysts’ estimates, reflecting the anticipated fallout from a global trade war on industries from cars to smartphones.

title: NATO-Backed German Startup Raises Funds for Military Robots
content: ARX Robotics, a German defense startup backed by NATO’s technology fund, has raised venture capital funding for the second time in the past year as it plans an expansion in the UK.

title: US Shoppers Pay for Trump Tariffs on Temu, Doubling Some Prices
content: Discount Chinese retail app Temu appears to be passing on nearly all of Donald Trump’s new import taxes to US consumers, more than doubling the cost of some products in a move that may add to concern about the inflationary impact of tariffs.

title: Data Centers Are Emerging in Malaysia’s Negeri Sembilan State
content: Malaysia’s Negeri Sembilan state is emerging as a new hub for data centers as the top market of Johor grapples with the facilities’ voracious consumption of energy and water.

title: Global Race to Lure US Researchers Intensifies as Trump Slashes Science Funding
content: A global race to recruit US scientists is heating up as President Donald Trump’s sweeping cuts to research funding and federal agencies trigger an exodus from the country’s research institutions.

title: UK Food Prices Rise Most in 15 Months as Tax Hike Starts
content: UK food prices posted their biggest rise in more than a year after supermarkets were hit by a double whammy of tax increases and a jump in the national minimum wage, a closely watched survey found.

title: China Vows to Stand Firm, Urges Nations to Resist ‘Bully’ Trump
content: China’s top diplomat warned countries against caving in to US tariff threats, as the Trump administration hints at the possible use of new trade tools to pressure Beijing.

title: China Says Willing to Cooperate With US After Boeing Spat
content: China is willing to support normal cooperation with US companies, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said, just days after Chinese airlines rejected taking delivery of any new jets from US planemaker Boeing Co.

title: ECB’s Kazaks Hopeful That Step-by-Step Rate Cuts May Continue
content: The European Central Bank should be able to carry on with gradual interest-rate reductions, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.

title: Tariff War Shows Asian Nations Need New Trade Partners: ADB Head
content: Asian countries should diversify their trading partners and boost domestic demand to ensure they can ride out the current global trade war, the head of the Asian Development Bank said.

title: Czech Central Banker Signals Next Rate Cut May Be Last for Now
content: A Czech central bank deputy chief signaled the nation’s monetary easing cycle may be coming to an end as a rebounding housing market adds to inflation risks.

title: Hungary to Hold Rates as Tariffs Muddle Outlook
content: Hungary’s central bank is poised to hold interest rates for a seventh month as global trade tensions weigh on the economic outlook.

title: Malaysia to Delay New Taxes as Manufacturers Fear Tariff Hit
content: Malaysia is delaying a planned expansion of its sales and service tax, providing a temporary reprieve for manufacturers bracing for higher US tariffs.

title: RBA’s Kent Highlights Recent ‘Sharp Rise’ in Aussie Volatility
content: Global foreign exchange markets recorded a “sharp rise” in volatility earlier this month as traders worked through the potential impact of US tariff announcements, before becoming “more settled” in recent days, according to Reserve Bank of Australia Assistant Governor Christopher Kent.

title: Japan Worries Trump Tariffs Will Push Countries Toward China
content: US President Donald Trump’s tariffs could push Asian nations closer to China and destabilize regional security, Japan’s ruling party policy chief warned, calling for stronger defense ties between Washington and Tokyo.

title: Can Australia’s Housing Crisis Be Fixed?
content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Host Chris Bourke talks to the Grattan Institute’s Brendan Coates about the major parties’ competing housing policies ahead of the federal election

title: New Zealand Job Creation Remains Weak as Tariffs Spook Employers
content: New Zealand’s filled jobs rose only slightly in the first three months, reinforcing signs the labor market will take time to mend as concerns about growth at home and abroad leave employers reluctant to hire.

title: Bessent Sets July 4 Tax Bill Goal as Economic Worries Mount
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent set a July 4 goal to pass President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax cut package as polling shows that voters largely disapprove of the White House’s handling of the economy.

title: US, Mexico Reach Key Water, Screwworm Deals Ahead of Trade Talks
content: The US and Mexico reached two key agreements for the agricultural sector on Monday, smoothing over conflicts that threatened to escalate tensions between the neighbors amid trade negotiations brought on by Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Petro’s ‘Vampire’ IMF Spat Sends Colombian Bonds Falling
content: Colombian bonds dropped after the International Monetary Fund paused access to an $8.1 billion credit line, adding to concerns about the South American country’s widening budget deficit.

title: Carney Promises to Strengthen Canada in Victory Speech
content: Voters enter a polling location during a federal election in Calgary, Alberta, on April 28. Photographer: Gavin John/Bloomberg

title: New Zealand to Tighten Budget Belt as US Tariffs Threaten Growth
content: New Zealand’s government has been forced to slash new spending in this year’s budget as sweeping US tariffs threaten to curb global growth and imperil the country’s fiscal recovery.

title: Wall Street Sees US Playing Safe on Debt After Market Chaos
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s debt-management team is expected to keep the department’s plans for sales of longer-dated securities steady, especially after recent swings in the $29 trillion market.

title: US Boosts Net Quarterly Borrowing Estimate to $514 Billion
content: The US Treasury ramped up its estimate for federal borrowing for the current quarter to account for a much smaller starting stockpile of cash than it had projected — a consequence of Congress having failed as yet to raise the federal debt limit.

title: Australia’s Economic ‘Miracle’ Is Ending No Matter Who Wins Vote
content: The two main candidates are pitching contrasting visions to an electorate seeing living standards decline

title: Sheinbaum’s Popularity Passes AMLO’s, Feeding Mexican Economic Optimism
content: President Claudia Sheinbaum is more admired by Mexicans than even her popular predecessor Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, a status that is fueling economic optimism despite risks of a recession and the perils of a US trade war.

title: Tariff ‘Chaos’ Drags Key Texas Manufacturing Gauge to Worst Since 2020
content: A widely followed measure of Texas manufacturing activity weakened significantly as executives used words like “chaos” and “insanity” to describe the turmoil spurred by President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to a report by the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas.

title: Lagarde Isn’t Winning Over Disgruntled ECB Staff in Union Survey
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde is struggling to win over staff who say they have little faith in the institution’s top management.

title: Washington State Tax Hikes Target Tech Giants That Made It Rich
content: New taxes passed in the final days of Washington’s legislative session seek to bridge a record budget deficit by shifting more of the tax burden to technology companies like Amazon.com and Microsoft Corp.

title: Panama Seeks US Cooperation Without Taking Sides in Trade War
content: Panama expects more cooperation with the US but is avoiding taking sides in a trade war between the world’s two largest economies, according to its finance chief.

title: Global Military Spending Surges as Europe Tackles Russian Threat
content: Defense spending surged last year by the most since at least the end of the Cold War, according to data published Monday, with European countries rushing to bolster their security in the face of threats from Russia.

title: Euro Rally Catches Bessent’s Eye as Bets for ECB Rate Cuts Grow
content: The euro’s rally is getting the attention of officials on both sides of the Atlantic, fueling expectations for deeper interest-rate reductions by the European Central Bank as the gains show little sign of slowing.

title: NYC’s Congestion Toll Raised $159 Million in the First Quarter
content: New York City’s congestion pricing toll pulled in $159 million in the first three months of the program as the Trump administration is pushing to end the controversial initiative.

title: ECB’s Rehn Sees Downside Risks to March Inflation Forecasts
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn said there’s a danger that inflation will dip below the 2% target due to the fallout from US trade levies, reiterating that this would be grounds to further lower interest rates.

title: ECB’s Guindos Warns of Disorderly Market Risk Amid Trade Turmoil
content: European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said that volatile financial markets must be watched closely amid the risk of declines spiraling out of control.

title: AB Foods Reports Profit Dip With Sugar Unit Slow to Recover
content: Associated British Foods Plc reported a 10% decline in adjusted operating profit due to a loss at the British conglomerate’s sugar business.

title: Porsche Cuts Profit Outlook Over US Tariffs, EV Slowdown
content: Porsche AG said its profit margin will slip into single digits this year, with the luxury-car maker warning about US tariffs and higher costs from weak electric-vehicle adoption.

title: Sweden’s Top Two Banks Beat Expectations for Lending Profits
content: Sweden’s two biggest lenders by market value, SEB AB and Swedbank AB, reported better-than-feared lending income during the first quarter, with weakness offset by lower funding costs.

title: Volvo Car Eyes $1.87 Billion in Cost Cuts to Protect Profits
content: Volvo Car AB is embarking on an 18 billion Swedish kronor ($1.87 billion) cost cutting program to counter tepid demand and trade tensions weighing on the auto industry.

title: Alphawave Extends Deadline for Qualcomm Bid as Talks Continue
content: Alphawave IP Group Plc said it has extended the deadline for Qualcomm Inc. to make a firm bid for the London-listed semiconductor company until May 12 to give the companies more time to discuss terms of a potential deal.

title: China Says Willing to Cooperate With US After Boeing Spat
content: China is willing to support normal cooperation with US companies, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said, just days after Chinese airlines rejected taking delivery of any new jets from US planemaker Boeing Co.

title: India Plans to Highlight Boeing Order Pipeline in US Trade Talks
content: Indian trade negotiators are planning to showcase the country’s large pipeline of Boeing Co. plane orders and the potential for more to come as they seek a favorable deal with the US, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Woodside Gives Final Nod for $17.5 Billion US LNG Project
content: Woodside Energy Group Ltd. made a final investment decision on a $17.5 billion liquefied natural gas export project in the US, cementing the Australian company’s position as a top supplier of the super-chilled fuel.

title: HelloFresh Earnings Triple as Efficiency Program Bears Fruit
content: HelloFresh SE said first-quarter earnings more than tripled as its efficiency program started bearing fruit.

title: HSBC Faces $1.6 Billion Charge as China Recapitalizes BoCom
content: HSBC Holdings Plc said it expects to record a pretax loss of as much as $1.6 billion as China’s Finance Ministry recapitalizes Bank of Communications Co. and diluted the London-based lender’s stake in the company.

title: US PE Inrfrastructure Firm I Squared Plans Saudi Arabia Expansion
content: I Squared Capital plans to set up shop in Saudi Arabia this year as the US private equity fund hunts for acquisitions and deals in the infrastructure space in the Middle East.

title: Deutsche Bank Debt Trading Hits Record on Market Volatility
content: Deutsche Bank AG’s trading unit hit a record in the first quarter as the lender benefited from market volatility.

title: DWS Draws €20 Billion as Clients Pile Into Passive Funds
content: DWS Group, the investment arm of Deutsche Bank AG, reported net inflows of €20 billion ($22.8 billion) as retail and institutional investors continued to pile into its passively managed products.

title: Swedbank’s Lending Profit Beats Estimates on Lower Funding Costs
content: Swedbank AB’s first-quarter profit from lending slightly exceeded estimates, helped by lower deposit rates and funding costs.

title: HSBC Soothes Investors With Another Buyback in Rocky Market
content: HSBC Holdings Plc unveiled a fresh buyback for shareholders despite an increasingly fragile geopolitical backdrop that has weighed on the global economy and markets.

title: Amundi’s Inflows Top Estimates as Pace Seen Continuing for Year
content: Amundi SA reported another bumper quarter of inflows and said it should be able to keep up the pace for the rest of 2025 despite macroeconomic uncertainties and tariff wars.

title: Several ECB Officials Want Fewer Banks to Face Direct Oversight
content: Several top euro-zone officials want to exempt more lenders from European Central Bank oversight as part of efforts to simplify banking regulation, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: China’s First K-Pop Concert in Years Signal Efforts to Mend Ties
content: Nearly a decade after China imposed an unofficial ban on K-pop performances in the mainland, Beijing appears to be lowering one of the non-trade barriers that kept South Korea’s cultural phenomenon out of the country.

title: Citic Sees ‘Turning Point’ for China’s Steel Industry This Year
content: China’s steel industry is expected to see a “turning point” this year on additional stimulus measures and production cuts, even as overseas tariffs put pressure on demand, according to Citic Securities.

title: CSI Solar to Relocate Production Capacity Under Tariff Threat
content: CSI Solar Co., one of China’s top solar manufacturers, said it will maximize exports from its Southeast Asian production bases before punitive US tariffs kick in, while also preparing to move capacity to other regions facing lower duties.

title: Trump to Offer Auto Tariffs Reprieve After Carmaker Appeals
content: President Donald Trump is on track to ease the impact of his auto tariffs, with changes sought by the industry that would lift some levies on foreign parts for cars and trucks made inside the US.

title: Hanwha in Advanced Talks Over Arms Production for Saudi Arabia
content: Hanwha Aerospace Co. is in advanced discussions with Saudi Arabia over potential arms collaboration as the Middle East becomes the company’s main focus, according to the head of its global defense business.

title: Spain Faces Long Night as Blackout Drags On Without Answers
content: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez warned of a “long night ahead,” as the worst blackout to hit Europe in over a decade approached the 12-hour mark with no cause clearly identified and an uncertain timeline for the full restoration of power.

title: Amazon’s Kuiper Satellites Launch to Space in SpaceX Challenge
content: Amazon.com Inc.’s first batch of production satellites launched toward low-Earth orbit on Monday, the biggest step to date in the company’s effort to establish a business broadcasting internet connectivity from space.

title: Delta Routes New Airbus Plane to Tokyo to Sidestep Trump Tariffs
content: Delta Air Lines Inc. is flying a new Airbus SE plane through Japan to skirt US import tariffs as President Donald Trump’s trade war threatens the flow of new jets to the the aviation industry.

title: Newark Airport Flights Delayed on Equipment, Staffing Problems
content: The US Federal Aviation Administration slowed departures and arrivals at Newark Liberty International Airport on Monday due to issues with staffing and air-traffic control equipment, underscoring the fragility of the US system.

title: Why Restarting a Power Grid After Massive Collapse Is So Hard
content: It’s a worst case scenario that grid operators plan for but hope never to encounter. After one of the worst blackouts in Europe in more than a decade, electricity grid operators in Spain and Portugal are trying to get networks back up and running from the ground up.

title: Why Cheap Oil Relieves Some, Worries Other Countries
content: When US President Donald Trump was inaugurated to his second term as president on Jan. 20, oil prices were close to the highs of the summer before. By early April, they had fallen to a four-year low, and ticked up only slightly later in the month.

title: NFL’s Commanders Ink $3.8 Billion Stadium Deal for DC Return
content: After nearly three decades of playing in Maryland, the Washington Commanders are headed back to the District of Columbia to build a new home at the site of RFK Stadium, where the club played until the mid-1990s.

title: Tesla Investor Fights With Musk Over Billionaire’s Pay in Appeal
content: A Tesla Inc. shareholder urged Delaware’s highest court to uphold a decision that struck down Elon Musk’s record-setting pay package, as the world’s richest person fights to recover it on appeal.

content: A notorious pimp who took credit for recruiting Ashley Dupré, the hooker whose tryst with then-Gov. Eliot Spitzer ended the "Luv Guv's" career, claims in a lawsuit that a YouTuber has ruined his rep.

title: Wiz Khalifa takes credit for getting Snoop Dogg's kids stoned for the first time
content: The "Black and Yellow" rapper revealed that he smoked weed with Snoop Dogg’s sons Corde and Cordell during the filming of the musicians' 2012 stoner comedy “Mac & Devin Go to High School.”

title: A court in Ivory Coast removes a former Credit Suisse CEO from the presidential ballot
content: A lawyer says an Ivory Coast court has ruled that former Credit Suisse CEO Tidjane Thiam is not eligible to run for president because of his dual Ivorian-French nationality.

content: The California Senate is expected to vote AB1138's sister bill out of committee on Wednesday

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.

content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Air France-KLM Loss Narrows on Premium Travel, Cheaper Fuel
content: Air France-KLM reported a narrower first-quarter loss as the airline benefited from a lower fuel bill, cost cuts and consistently strong demand for premium travel.

title: Indian Buyers Balk at High Gold Prices During Festive Season
content: Bride-to-be Arpita Agarwal visited one of India’s largest gold markets earlier this week to buy traditional jewelry for her wedding guests — chains for men and rings for women. But as she navigated the crowded lanes of Old Delhi’s Chandni Chowk, the lofty prices made her reconsider.

title: Samsung Profit Slows After US-China Trade War Hits AI Spending
content: Samsung Electronics Co. reported slower profit growth and softening demand for storage chips, a sign that the US-China trade war may be triggering cuts in artificial intelligence hardware spending.

title: Glencore Expects Lower Trading Profits on Uncertain Outlook
content: Glencore Plc expects commodity marketing profits to fall again this year with increasing uncertainty over the prospects for the global economy.

title: TotalEnergies Keeps Investor Payouts Despite Weak Outlook
content: TotalEnergies SE drew a contrast with its industry peers, sticking to plans for both investor payouts and project investment despite a profit miss and a weak outlook for oil markets.

title: French Economy Returns to Growth But Still Faces Trade Hit
content: France’s economy returned to growth at the start of the year but showed little momentum as it headed into a tougher environment marred by global trade tensions.

title: Sony Group Shares Soar as It’s Said to Consider Chip Spinoff
content: Sony Group Corp. shares surged after people familiar with the matter said it is mulling spinning off its semiconductor unit, raising expectations that such a move would unlock value in the Japanese entertainment and electronics company.

title: GSK’s Profit Beat Estimates on Asthma, HIV Drugs
content: GSK Plc reported better-than-expected profit in the first quarter, with sales from its asthma and HIV drugs offsetting a lackluster vaccine performance.

title: Oil Set for Historic April Selloff as Trade War Darkens Outlook
content: Oil headed for its biggest, full-month loss for April on signs the US-led trade war is hurting economic growth and energy demand at a time when the OPEC+ alliance has been loosening supply curbs.

title: Thailand Says Moody’s Jumped the Gun With ‘Negative’ Outlook
content: Thailand said Moody’s Ratings “jumped the gun” when it changed its outlook for the country to negative without awaiting the outcome of the Southeast Asian nation’s delayed trade talks with the US, which is threatening to impose an 36% tariff.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 4/30/2025
content:
Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture.
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 04/30/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mercedes Withdraws Guidance Over Trump’s Auto Tariffs
content: Mercedes-Benz Group AG withdrew its outlook for the year over the US auto tariffs, joining several automakers hit by the uncertainty tied to President Donald Trump’s trade moves.

title: Aberdeen Assets Drop Again on Client Outflows, Market Volatility
content: Aberdeen Group Plc’s assets shrunk by £11.3 billion ($15 billion) in the first quarter as a volatile market and outflows combined to dent performance.

title: Veteran Investor Mobius Says 'Cash Is King' Right Now
content: Mark Mobius tells Bloomberg Television that 95% of his funds’ holdings are in cash given trade-related uncertainty. "At this stage, cash is king," he says, adding "we got to keep the cash and be ready to move when the time is right." Mobius also shares his views on the Trump administration as well as Chinese and Indian markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: France Seeks Small Parcel Fees as Flows From China Surge
content: France is pushing to slap fees on small packages from discount retailers including China’s Temu and Shein Group Ltd. as the flood of cheap goods risks accelerating in response to the US’s sweeping tariffs.

title: In Full: UBS CEO on Earnings, Volatility, Credit Suisse
content: UBS Group AG Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti discusses the lender’s performance in the first quarter as net income for the three months to March came in at $1.7 billion, beating estimates. Speaking to Bloomberg’s Tom Mackenzie, Ermotti also talks about clients’ response to ongoing volatility spurred by geopolitical factors such as trade and tariffs, as well as the lender’s plans in the US.

title: Remy Cointreau Suffers Sales Drop Due to China Trade Tariffs
content: Remy Cointreau SA suffered a further drop in Cognac sales, as anti-dumping measures in China continued to limit demand in its key market.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 04/30/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Avril Hong and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gold-Backed ETFs Stage a Comeback in 2025 on Trade War Fears
content: Investors rattled by the growing global trade war flocked to gold-backed exchange-traded funds in the first quarter, with inflows propelling bullion’s 19% rally in the three-month period, according to the World Gold Council.

title: US Stock Futures Drop With Tech Earnings in Focus: Markets Wrap
content: A six-day rally in US stocks looks set to pause as equity-index futures declined following disappointing earnings from Super Micro Computer Inc. and as more companies withdraw their guidance.

title: ArcelorMittal Warns of Trade Risks While Steel Prices Rise
content: ArcelorMittal SA said US tariffs and European support for local steelmakers are boosting prices, but warned of potential disruptions from global trade uncertainty.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Extend Winning Streak, Barclays Rises
Mark Mobius Says His Funds Hold 95% in Cash on Trade War Risks
content: Veteran emerging-markets investor Mark Mobius is keeping the bulk of his funds’ holdings in cash as he waits out the trade-related uncertainty, which is likely to persist for up to six months.

title: Yuan’s Worst Month Since 2019 Masked by Resilience Versus Dollar
content: The yuan is enjoying a relief this month from the dollar’s decline but it’s weakening against other trading partners’ currencies, giving Chinese exports an edge in the face of steep US tariffs.

title: Vietnam’s Lam Hails ‘Profound’ Lessons 50 Years After End of War
content: Vietnam’s top leader said his nation is ready to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with the world’s great powers, as tens of thousands gathered to watch a military parade marking 50 years since the end of the war and the defeat of the US-backed southern regime.

title: Rashid: Want to Use Digital Infrastructure for Iraq
content: Telecom provider, iQ Group, has developed a 3,500-kilometer fiber optic project as an alternative to the Red Sea route. The company says the network reduces latency and improves the reliability of internet traffic. iQ Group CEO, Asoz Rashid spoke to Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on Iarq's tech ambitions. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Credit Agricole’s Costs, Tax Bill Spoil Last Quarter for Brassac
content: Credit Agricole SA Chief Executive Officer Philippe Brassac saw revenue rise to a record in his final quarter at the helm of the French lender, but higher-than-expected costs and a French tax bill weighed on profit.

title: Canada Escaped a Trump Trap, But Carney's Boxed In
content: He’ll need to keep everybody happy with higher spending to survive, and forget compromise.

title: Japan Shipper Stocks Fall as Mitsui OSK Miss Stokes Tariff Fears
content: Shares of Japanese marine transport firms plunged after Mitsui OSK Lines’ earnings forecast missed market estimates, fueling concerns about the impact of Donald Trump’s tariffs on the shipping industry.

title: Spain’s Toxic Politics Clouds Probe Into Power Blackout
content: Squabbles between Spain’s minority government and opposition parties are muddling efforts to find out and explain what caused a massive blackout that left Spain, Portugal and parts of France in the dark on Monday.

title: US Races to Calm India-Pakistan Tensions as Signs Mount of Clash
content: The US is pushing to calm tensions between India and Pakistan as signs mount of an imminent clash after militants last week killed dozens of tourists on the Indian-controlled side of the disputed Himalayan region of Kashmir.

title: China Manufacturing Slumps on US Levies, Spurring Stimulus Calls
content: China’s factory activity slipped into the worst contraction since December 2023, revealing early damage from Donald Trump’s tariffs and prompting calls for a speedy policy boost.

title: France Seeks Small Parcel Fees as Flows From China Surge
content: France is pushing to slap fees on small packages from discount retailers including China’s Temu and Shein Group Ltd. as the flood of cheap goods risks accelerating in response to the US’s sweeping tariffs.

title: Spain’s Prime Minister Summoned Utilities to Discuss Blackout
content: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez held a meeting Tuesday evening with executives from the country’s main utilities to discuss the blackout and plans going forward.

title: Vietnam’s Lam Hails ‘Profound’ Lessons 50 Years After End of War
content: Vietnam’s top leader said his nation is ready to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with the world’s great powers, as tens of thousands gathered to watch a military parade marking 50 years since the end of the war and the defeat of the US-backed southern regime.

title: Switzerland’s Neutrality Is Holding Back Its Defense Industry
content: Strict export rules for arms threaten the country’s small but symbolically important industry in the wake of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: Nigel Farage’s Rise Drives Cracks in Britain’s Two-Party System
content: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK Party is poised to emerge as the biggest winner in England’s local elections on Thursday, potentially laying the ground for a wider fracturing of British politics and the end of the country’s traditional Labour-Conservative duopoly.

title: Philippines, New Zealand Sign Visiting Forces Agreement
content: The Philippines and New Zealand signed a deal on military visits that bolsters the two nations’ security ties.

title: Who’s Likely to Win Australia’s Election and What’s at Stake?
content: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese could become the first Australian leader in more than two decades to win consecutive terms in office, with polls showing his center-left government is in the lead ahead of a national election on May 3.

title: China Adopts Law to Protect Private Companies Amid Trade War
content: China’s top legislature passed a bill aimed at boosting the private sector, in a symbolic move to rally entrepreneurs and shore up confidence as Beijing hunkers down for a “protracted” trade war with the US.

title: Trump Says DOGE Has Prompted Justice Department Referrals
content: President Donald Trump said that fraud allegedly uncovered by Elon Musk’s government cost-cutting team had been referred to the Justice Department for criminal investigation.

title: Trump Predicts China Would ‘Eat’ Tariffs, Lessening US Impact
content: President Donald Trump said China deserved the steep tariffs he imposed on their exports and predicted Beijing could find a way to reduce their impact on American consumers.

title: In Singapore’s Election, Success Is Less About Who Wins Than by How Much
content: The ruling People’s Action Party has dominated the city-state for six decades

title: Trump Flags Plans to Talk Trade With Australian PM as Vote Nears
content: US President Donald Trump has flagged the possibility of another call with Australia’s prime minister to discuss tariffs he imposed on the longtime American ally.

title: Trump Bashes Powell, Touts Tariffs at Rally Marking 100 Days
content: President Donald Trump renewed criticism of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell as he championed his economic policies and tariff regime during a Tuesday event to mark his 100th day in office.

title: Trump Signs Order to Prevent His Auto Tariffs From Stacking on Top of Each Other
content: President Donald Trump signed a pair of directives easing the impact of his tariffs on the automotive industry, yielding to weeks of intense lobbying from automakers, parts suppliers and dealers who warned excessive levies could push up car prices, triggering plant shutdowns and job losses.

title: Hegseth Slams Law on Women in Conflict Signed by Trump
content: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced Tuesday that he was ending Pentagon participation in an initiative on women and conflict that President Donald Trump signed into law during his first term with backing from prominent members of the current administration.

title: Chile Keeps Rates at 5% and Cites Risk of Slow Global Growth
content: Chile’s central bank kept its interest rate unchanged for the third meeting, citing the global turmoil triggered by President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs and elevated inflation that is expected to slow to target.

title: North Korea Test Fires New Warship’s Weapons, KCNA Says
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un observed the testing of naval missile and artillery systems earlier this week, state media Korean Central News Agency reported Wednesday, days after acknowledging for the first time that Pyongyang was aiding Moscow’s war on Ukraine.

title: Harvard’s President Says ‘I’m Sorry’ After Reports on Bias
content: Harvard University released its long-awaited reports on antisemitism and anti-Muslim bias, presenting a scathing critique of how its students treated each other in the aftermath of the Hamas attack against Israel on Oct. 7, 2023.

title: Xi Is Trying to Turn World Against US as Trump Cuts Deals
content: President Xi Jinping’s diplomats are fanning out across the world with a clear message for countries cutting deals with Donald Trump: The US is a bully that can’t be trusted.

title: El Salvador Says It’s Still Buying Bitcoin After IMF Accord
content: El Salvador is still purchasing Bitcoin even after inking a loan agreement with International Monetary Fund that required it to stop accumulating the token.

title: Pro-SALT Republicans to Debate Deduction Increase on Wednesday
content: Republican lawmakers pushing for the expansion of the state and local tax deduction in President Donald Trump’s economic package are slated to meet with House Speaker Mike Johnson to get specific about how much to increase the $10,000 cap on the write-off.

title: Emhoff Says He’s Been Removed From US Holocaust Museum Board
content: Former second gentleman Doug Emhoff said he has been removed from his post at the United States Holocaust Memorial Council, the board that oversees the museum documenting the Nazi genocide of Jews and other minorities during World War II.

title: McDonald’s, Coca-Cola Still See Risks to Operating in Russia
content: McDonald’s Corp. and Coca-Cola Co. said they continue to see risks to operating in Russia, a signal that major US firms remain cautious about business investments in the country.

title: Florida to Ban Fluoride From Drinking Water, Advancing RFK Cause
content: Florida’s legislature passed a law banning fluoride in drinking water, a move that advances growing skepticism among conservative lawmakers towards long-accepted dental hygiene.

title: Carney’s Plan to Manage Trump: Keep Calm, Find New Friends
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney won election Monday by promising to manage a mercurial US president bent on waging a global trade war.

title: Trump’s 100 Days Sets Up Next Test for His Agenda
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Stephanie Lai looks at how the president’s first 100 days could set the tone for the rest of his term. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Putin Is Said to Demand Ukraine Land Despite US Pressure
content: President Vladimir Putin is insisting that Russia must take control of four regions of Ukraine it doesn’t fully occupy as part of any agreement to end his war, according to three people in Moscow familiar with the matter.

title: Indian Buyers Balk at High Gold Prices During Festive Season
content: Bride-to-be Arpita Agarwal visited one of India’s largest gold markets earlier this week to buy traditional jewelry for her wedding guests — chains for men and rings for women. But as she navigated the crowded lanes of Old Delhi’s Chandni Chowk, the lofty prices made her reconsider.

title: SocGen Shares Jump as CEO Krupa’s Turnaround Gathers Pace
content: Societe Generale SA beat analysts’ estimates for profit and revenue in the first quarter as it benefited from a surge in equities trading and booked a gain on disposals.

title: Stellantis Posts Sales Slump, Suspends Guidance on Tariffs
content: Stellantis NV posted weaker sales on slumping demand in North America, while suspending its financial guidance for the year on uncertainty tied to President Donald Trump’s auto tariffs.

title: Trump 100 Days: US President Touts Tariffs, Bashes Powell at Rally | Daybreak Europe 04/30/2025
content:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, US President Donald Trump marked 100 days of his second term by again criticising Fed chair Jerome Powell, and touting his economic policies. Trump also signed orders to ease tariffs on the auto industry, just hours before a rally in Michigan. 

Meanwhile, UBS and Santander smash estimates for net income. While, Mercedes warns that trade uncertainty is too high for a reliable outlook.

Today's Guests: Gesine Weber, Geostrategy Team fellow at the German Marshall Fund, DHL Group CEO Tobias Meyer, Viki Farmaki, Senior Analyst at State Street Global Advisors & Equinor's CEO, Anders Opedal. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: UBS CEO Sees Ongoing Volatility Amid Tariffs Uncertainty
content: UBS Group AG Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti discusses the lender’s performance in the first quarter as its markets division posted a record performance. Speaking to Bloomberg’s Tom Mackenzie, Ermotti adds that he doesn’t think peak volatility has been reached. “If this goes on for too long, uncertainty has also a cost, and therefore probably investors and corporates will slow down their investment plans,” he says.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Europe: Trump Slams Powell Again (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 20:36

title: UBS Profit Beats Estimates on Trading Revenue Surge
content: Good morning. UBS’s profit beats estimates. Trump renews criticism of his Federal Reserve chair. And Ikea backs a traffic-free Oxford Street in London. Listen to the day’s top stories.

content: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.

title: Switzerland’s Neutrality Is Holding Back Its Defense Industry
content: Strict export rules for arms threaten the country’s small but symbolically important industry in the wake of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: UK Student Homes Taking Longer to Fill on Weaker Overseas Demand
content: The proportion of UK student dorms that are leased for the next academic year has fallen sharply as a post-pandemic boom that’s lured a plethora of the world’s biggest private equity firms begins to fade.

title: Nomura’s China Losses Narrow as Brokerage Seeks Turnaround
content: Nomura Holdings Inc. posted a smaller loss at its joint venture in China last year, as the brokerage seeks to turn around the business in the face of slowing growth and trade tensions.

title: Hong Kong’s Battered Retailers Brace for Another Holiday Exodus
content: In this week’s Hong Kong Edition, we look at how holidays are worsening the situation for the city’s retail industry, highlight the poor outlook for Macau casino operators and recall the time Jesus sat with the Easter bunny in our review of a Japanese restaurant in Sheung Wan.

content: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, President Trump marks his first 100 days this week with a rally in Michigan. Guests include: John Bozzella, Alliance for Automotive Innovation President & CEO, Sarah Chamberlain, Republican Main Street Partnership President & CEO, and Diane Swonk KPMG Chief Economist,  (Source: Bloomberg)

content: President Trump rallied supporters in Michigan to mark 100 days in office. Bloomberg’s Tyler Kendall is live on the ground with some key takeaways from the speech. (Source: Bloomberg)
