title: An Investor’s Guide to Australia’s Federal Election
content: Good morning, it’s Angus here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know as we head toward the election weekend in Australia.Today’s must-reads:• An investor’s guide to the election• Betting giants notch up win• Home prices reach fresh record

title: Stock Movers: Caterpillar, Starbucks, Snap (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:42

title: Tesla Chair Says Report of CEO Search to Replace Musk ‘False’
content: Tesla Inc. Chair Robyn Denholm denied a report that the board had looked to replace Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, saying directors are “highly confident” in his ability.

title: Apple Dealt Stinging Court Defeat on App Store Sales Commissions
content: Apple Inc. violated a court order requiring it to open up the App Store to third-party payment options and must stop charging commissions on purchases outside its software marketplace, a federal judge said in a ruling that referred the company to prosecutors for a possible criminal probe.

title: Google Places Ads Inside Chatbot Conversations With AI Startups
content: Google’s ad network has begun showing advertising within the flow of conversations with chatbots — part of Alphabet Inc.’s efforts to keep its edge in digital advertising as generative artificial intelligence takes off.

title: Murata Shares Drop by Most Since 2000 on Tariff-Hit Grim Outlook
content: Shares of iPhone components maker Murata Manufacturing Co. plunged 18% — the most in 25 years — after it said it’s bracing for a profit decline and warned the impact of tariffs was not yet fully priced in.

title: Altman-Backed Startup Rolls Out Eyeball-Scanning Tech Across US
content: Tools for Humanity, a startup co-founded by OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman, plans to roll out thousands of eyeball-scanning Orb devices across the US, marking a major expansion for the company and its novel identification services.

title: Meta Jumps as Advertising, AI Spending Defy Tariff Concerns
content: Meta Platforms Inc. quelled Wall Street concerns about the impact of the Trump administration’s trade war on advertising sales, reporting first-quarter revenue that beat expectations and forecasting additional spending.

title: Microsoft’s Shares Surge on Strong Quarterly Cloud Sales Growth
content: Microsoft Corp. shares jumped after the company reported stronger-than-expected quarterly sales and profit growth, suggesting customer demand for cloud services has held steady despite a wave of tariffs and economic turbulence.

title: Super Micro, Snap Warn of Headwinds, Grab Hikes Forecast | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the drop in Super Micro’s shares after the server maker preannounced results that fell well short of analysts' estimates. Plus, Boston Dynamics CEO Robert Playter discusses the future of robotics and competition with Tesla. And Grab CFO Peter Oey explains why the Southeast Asian delivery company raised its earnings forecast. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nvidia CEO Urges Trump to Change Rules for AI Chip Exports
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said he’d like the Trump administration to change regulations for exporting artificial intelligence technology from the US to the rest of the world so American businesses can better capitalize on the opportunities in the future.

title: Qualcomm Declines After Tepid Forecast Renews Tariff Concerns
content: Qualcomm Inc., the biggest maker of chips that run smartphones, slid in late trading after giving a tepid revenue forecast, underscoring concerns that tariffs will hurt demand for its products.

title: Chinese Hacking Competitions Fuel the Country’s Broad Cyber Ambitions
content: Participants are required to turn findings over to the Chinese government.

title: EBay Projects Solid Sales, Showing Resilience Amid Tariffs
content: EBay Inc. projected sales for the current quarter that exceeded analysts’ estimates, showing resilience in the face of exposure to President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Restaurant Software Maker Olo Is Exploring a Potential Sale
content: Restaurant software provider Olo Inc. is exploring a potential sale after attracting takeover interest, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Amazon Plans to Build Dozens of US Warehouses in Rural Expansion
content: Amazon.com Inc. plans to build dozens of warehouses to serve rural areas in the US before the end of next year, growing its footprint as the company works to rely less on other carriers.

title: How China Is Building an Army of Hackers
content: China and the US actively engage in cyber espionage for strategic advantage. Leaked files now suggest how rapidly Beijing is catching up in preparation for any future conflict. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Palantir CTO on Military Industrial Base Under Trump
content: Palantir CTO Shyam Sankar speaks with Bloomberg's Annmarie Hordern about his perspective on the military-industrial complex under the Trump administration. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ripple Offered to Buy Stablecoin Rival Circle or Up to $5 Billion
content: Ripple has proposed a takeover of rival stablecoin provider Circle Internet Group Inc. for $4 billion to $5 billion, a bid that was rejected as too low, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Meta Earnings Have High Bar to Clear After Shares Outperform
content: When Meta Platforms Inc. reports earnings on Wednesday afternoon, the social media giant will face a high hurdle to satisfy anxious investors.

title: Nvidia Gets Rare Sell Rating as Seaport Says AI Fully Priced In
content: Nvidia Corp. received a rare sell rating on Wednesday, with Seaport Global Securities warning that the benefit of artificial intelligence has been “priced in for now.”

title: Silicon Valley Comes to DC to Push for More AI, Less Government
content: Top Silicon Valley executives lavished praise on the Trump administration, supporting its efforts to cut the size of the federal government and create more business opportunities for US tech companies during a summit with lawmakers and officials.

title: Google’s Pichai Says US Fix Is ‘De Facto’ Spinoff of Search
content: Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai told a judge who found that Google illegally monopolizes online search that a Justice Department proposal to share search data with rivals would be a “de facto” divestiture of the company’s search engine.

title: Snowflake Cyber Boss Offers Lessons From Last Year’s Hack of Customers
content: Snowflake Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. US stocks traded steady, reversing gains from earlier in the day, as Wall Street traders weighed the latest earnings results and the impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Corporate America.

title: Google Eyes Gemini-iPhone AI Deal This Year, Pichai Tells Court
content: Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said in court proceedings Wednesday that he hopes that Gemini, his company’s AI service, will be added as a built-in option for iPhones this year.

title: Nvidia CEO on Tariffs, AI Chips, China Competition
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang talks about the need for the US to change the rules for exporting artificial intelligence technology to the rest of the world. He's in Washington to meet with US lawmakers. He also speaks about the growing technological power of Huawei and China. He spoke to reporters, including Bloomberg's Annmarie Hordern. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta, App Makers Launch Washington Lobby to Fight Apple and Google
content: App makers Meta Platforms Inc., Spotify Technology SA and Match Group Inc. are girding for a high-stakes political battle with the world’s two dominant smartphone platforms over who should take responsibility for verifying users’ ages.

title: Snap Falls After Warning ‘Headwinds’ Poised to Hurt Ad Sales
content: Shares of Snap Inc. tumbled after the company narrowly beat analysts’ estimates for first-quarter revenue but declined to issue a sales forecast for the current period, saying it’s navigating macroeconomic “headwinds” for its advertising business.

title: Grindr Pivots to Anthropic, Amazon to Power AI Wingman Feature
content: Grindr Inc. said it’s using artificial intelligence tools from Amazon.com Inc. and Anthropic to develop features for its “Wingman” product, rather than relying on chatbots from startup Ex-human Inc.

title: UK Grocer Co-op Suffers Hacking Attempt, Shuts Some Systems
content: British supermarket chain Co-op said it was the target of a hacking attempt, just days after Marks & Spencer Group Plc said it suffered a cyber incident that rendered some of the retailer’s systems inaccessible.

title: Super Micro Plunges After Preliminary Results Miss Estimates
content: Super Micro Computer Inc. tumbled Wednesday after giving preliminary results that fell well short of analysts’ estimates, a sign its comeback plan has been slow to gain traction.

title: EU Set to Concede Dependence on US Tech as Trump Tensions Flare
content: The European Union is set to concede it can’t break free from the power of US technology giants, in a move that could de-escalate a trade row with President Donald Trump.

title: Yen Weakens 1% Against Dollar as Ueda Emphasizes Uncertainty
content: The yen extended its declines against the dollar as Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda spoke of uncertainties due to tariffs, after the bank kept its rates steady and pushed back the expected timing of its price target.

title: Bank of Japan Pushes Back Inflation Target Due to Trade War
content: The Bank of Japan pushed back the timing for when it expects to reach its inflation target and slashed its growth forecasts as the global trade war initiated by Donald Trump darkens the economic outlook.

title: IMF Cuts Growth Outlook for Gulf Oil Producers After Price Slump
content: The International Monetary Fund downgraded its growth forecasts for oil exporting countries in the Middle East and North Africa, including Saudi Arabia and Iraq, citing escalating global trade tensions and lower energy prices.

title: IMF Says Egypt Should Be Vigilant in Easing Interest Rates
content: The International Monetary Fund said Egypt should tread carefully as it lowers interest rates, due to global uncertainty wrought by US President Donald Trump’s tariff raises.

title: How Australia’s Housing Market Became So Out of Reach
content: Ballooning property prices and rents are causing serious housing affordability problems in Australia. So how bad is it? And how did it get to this point?

title: Australia’s Opposition Pledges to Improve Budget by $9 Billion
content: Australia’s budget bottom line will be improved by about A$14 billion ($9 billion) over four years under a Liberal-National Coalition government, the opposition’s economic spokespeople said as they unveiled plans to cut the bureaucracy and scrap the Labor government’s tax cuts.

title: Bank of Japan Keeps Rates Unchanged as Tariffs Cloud Outlook
content: The Bank of Japan kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged amid widespread market expectations that Governor Kazuo Ueda wouldn’t raise rates given the uncertainty stemming from US tariffs.

title: Is This The End of Australia's 'Miracle' Economy?
content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Host Rebecca Jones talks to Bloomberg’s Asia economy reporter Swati Pandey and government reporter Ben Westcott about the country’s big economic challenges, ahead of this weekend’s election

title: Trump Says Tariffs Politically Risky, But He’s Not Rushing Deals
content: President Donald Trump acknowledged that his sweeping tariff program had risked imperiling him politically, but said he would not rush deals to appease nervous investors during a town hall on Wednesday.

title: South Korea’s Export Growth Stalls as US Tariffs Sap Demand
content: South Korea’s export growth stalled in April in a worrisome sign for the trade-driven economy as officials scramble to cope with Donald Trump’s sweeping tariff campaign.

title: US Has Reached Out to China to Initiate Tariff Talks, CCTV Says
content: US President Donald Trump’s administration has been seeking contact with Beijing to initiate talks on the massive tariffs Washington has imposed on China, according to a state-run media outlet.

title: Labour Should Be Ready to Bend Rules During Trade Talks, IPPR Says
content: The UK’s Labour government must be willing to bend international rules and ease its concerns over other countries’ human rights records when negotiating new trade partnerships, the left-wing Institute for Public Policy Research think tank said.

title: Goldman Sachs’ CEO Talks Policy Uncertainty, Tariffs
content: On today’s Big Take: How Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon is assessing the economic impact of Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: A $6 Billion Shortfall Has US Mass Transit Facing a Death Spiral
content: The federal government stepped in with $70 billion to get commuter rail and bus service through the pandemic. The funds are running out.

title: EU to Present New Trade Proposals to US Negotiators Next Week
content: The European Union is planning to share a paper with the US next week that will set out a package of proposals to kick-start trade negotiations with the Trump administration.

title: Colombia Stuns and Cuts Rates to 9.25% After Petro’s Demands
content: Colombia’s central bank unexpectedly cut its interest rate by 25 basis points, handing President Gustavo Petro a win while raising more doubts over monetary policy that’s been clouded by public spending and global volatility.

title: Mexico Economy Narrowly Dodges Recession Amid US Trade Chaos
content: Mexico’s economy expanded slightly in the first quarter on a jump in agricultural output, allowing President Claudia Sheinbaum to avoid recession as she steers the nation through an unpredictable US tariff policy.

title: Russia Raises 2025 Deficit Target on Lower Revenue Expectations
content: The Russian Finance Ministry increased its budget deficit target for this year after expectations for revenue and the oil price were reduced.

title: Loonie Gains on Trump Saying Carney Wants to Make a Deal
content: US President Donald Trump said newly elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney plans to visit the White House within the next week.

title: Gold Pares Losses as Traders Assess Fed Rate Path After US Data
content: Gold pared losses as traders assessed the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path after US data showed signs of downside risks under President Donald Trump’s trade agenda.

title: Trump’s ‘Erratic’ Tariff Policy Prompted Bank of Canada Pause
content: Bank of Canada officials considered cutting interest rates at their April meeting before opting to wait for more information as they weighed the volatile changes in US President Donald Trump’s trade policy.

title: How Donald Trump Became India’s New Best Friend
content: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss why India stands to gain from the US trade war with China and the rest of the world.

title: Why Did the US Economy Shrink in Early 2025?
content: What’s the single best way to measure the health of a country’s economy? For most experts, there is little debate that gross domestic product, a quarterly tally of all the goods and services a country produces, is the gold standard for assessing and comparing economic activity.

title: Zimbabwe Traders Face a Future of Losses From Once-Bullish Stock Market
content: Zimbabwe stock traders, long used to profiting from currency chaos that has spurred demand for equities, are counting their losses as a liquidity crunch curtails business.

title: Trump Says He’s Off to Best Start as President. The Economy Says Something Else
content: Trump’s second term begins with a decline in US GDP, while jobs and prices hold steady. On almost all fronts, the outlook is getting worse.

title: US Consumer Spending Jumps While Key Inflation Gauge Slows Down
content: US consumer spending jumped in March while a key measure of inflation decelerated, a welcome reprieve before tariffs are expected to broadly drive up prices.

title: US Economy Contracts for First Time Since 2022 on Imports Surge
content: The US economy contracted at the start of the year for the first time since 2022 on a monumental pre-tariffs import surge and more moderate consumer spending, a first snapshot of the ripple effects from President Donald Trump’s trade policy.

title: Australian House Prices Hit Record High Ahead of Saturday’s Vote
content: Australian home prices climbed for a third straight month to a record high ahead of an election on Saturday, while defying rising uncertainty over the economic fallout from US-driven global trade turmoil.

title: US Pending Sales of Existing Homes Increase by Most Since 2023
content: Pending sales of previously owned US homes rose in March by the most in more than a year as a brief dip in mortgage rates and a rising supply of houses brought out spring shoppers.

title: Tanzania Says $42 Billion LNG Deal Delayed On Local Content Use
content: Tanzania’s Deputy Prime Minister Doto Biteko said the government wants to agree the terms of a long-delayed $42 billion liquefied natural gas facility with international oil companies by October.

title: Rolls-Royce Backs 2025 Outlook, Says Tariffs Are Manageable
content: Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc expressed confidence the aircraft engine supplier can meet its financial goals for the year despite the uncertainty caused by the introduction of new tariffs.

title: US Vaccine Watchdog Effort Begins as Measles Surge Draws Alarm
content: The Center for Infectious Disease Research and Policy at the University of Minnesota has quietly begun to steer a national initiative to safeguard the scientific foundations of US vaccine policy — a bold move at a time of mounting political interference and an escalating measles outbreak.

title: Lloyds Income Boosted as Homebuyers Rushed to Beat Stamp Duty
content: Lloyds Banking Group Plc ramped up lending in the first quarter, helping it broadly meet earnings expectations even as it set aside more to prepare for a worsening economy.

title: Tesla Chair Says Report of CEO Search to Replace Musk ‘False’
content: Tesla Inc. Chair Robyn Denholm denied a report that the board had looked to replace Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, saying directors are “highly confident” in his ability.

title: Macau Gaming Revenue Better Than Feared Ahead of Golden Week
content: Macau’s gaming revenue rose 1.7% in April, exceeding analyst expectation for a decline, signaling stronger tourism demand ahead of China’s May “Golden Week” holiday starting Thursday.

title: FDA to Mandate Placebo-Controlled Trials for New Vaccines
content: The US Food and Drug Administration will require all new vaccines to undergo placebo-controlled trials before approval — a policy shift that could reshape how immunizations are developed.

title: Quebec Government Won’t Rescue Bankrupt Bus Maker Lion Electric
content: Canadian electric bus and truck maker Lion Electric Co. is unlikely to survive as the Quebec government turned down an opportunity to put money into the firm along with local investors.

title: Starbucks Seeks to Slash Million-Dollar Store Renovation Costs
content: Starbucks Corp. is looking to cut how much it spends upgrading stores, which could help address investor anxiety over the price tag of turning the chain around.

title: TSG Consumer Nears Investment in Cookie Chain Crumbl
content: Private equity firm TSG Consumer Partners is in advanced talks to invest in Crumbl, the fast-growing cookie and dessert chain, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: FC Barcelona to Move US Headquarters to Miami From New York City
content: FC Barcelona will move its US commercial operations to Miami from New York, burnishing the South Florida city’s reputation as an American soccer hub.

title: Big Price Hikes Undercut Trump Bet China Will Absorb Tariffs
content: Donald Trump says China will likely bear the brunt of his 145% tariff on the world’s second-largest economy. But prices from some of the most popular sellers of made-in-China goods already suggest US shoppers will be paying a major portion of the bill.

title: Trade War Leads Canadian Pacific Kansas City Railway to Lower 2025 Guidance
content: Canadian Pacific Kansas City Ltd. cut its financial outlook for this year due to the uncertainty caused by the US administration’s tariff and trade policy.

title: Telefonica’s Movistar Faces Venezuela Data Leak, NGO Says
content: A local non-profit reported a massive data leak from Spain’s Telefonica SA subsidiary in Venezuela, Movistar, which exposed the personal data of millions of clients, highlighting the vulnerability of the country’s digital communications.

title: Loose Cigarettes, Shorter Calls Mark Slowdown for Mexican Firms
content: As US tariff threats continue to wreak havoc on the Mexican economy, consumers are cutting back on everything from cell service and coffee to cigarettes and tequila. That’s hitting the country’s biggest companies including billionaire Carlos Slim’s wireless provider America Movil SAB and retail conglomerate Femsa.

title: For Musk, By Musk: World’s Richest Man Adds a Texas City to His Empire
content: With this weekend’s vote to incorporate, the billionaire’s takeover of Starbase will be complete.

title: Robinhood Tops Estimates Amid Volatility as Crypto Slows
content: Retail investors flocked to Robinhood Markets Inc. as President Donald Trump’s global tariffs roiled markets, boosting the company’s revenue and earnings, even as growth in cryptocurrency revenue slowed.

title: Disney, Universal Score China Film Dates Despite Trade Woes
content: China is keeping the door open for Hollywood movies, even with the ongoing trade dispute with the US.

title: Wingstop Shares Rebound After Projecting Return to Growth
content: Wingstop Inc. shares gained the most in more than two years Wednesday after flagging that same-stores sales will recover in the second half of the year.

title: Airbus Tells US Airlines They’ll Need to Pay Their Own Tariffs
content: Airbus SE said it won’t cover the cost of tariffs on its planes imported by US airlines, setting up a clash with carriers unwilling to shoulder surcharges imposed by President Donald Trump.

title: Visa CEO Says AI Shopping to Push Advertising, Payments to Adapt
content: Visa Inc. Chief Executive Officer Ryan McInerney said advertising will be forced to evolve as shoppers turn to artificial intelligence agents to help them browse products and make purchases.

title: Rivian Stockpiled EV Batteries From Asia Ahead of Trump Tariffs
content: Rivian Automotive Inc. quietly built a reserve of electric-vehicle batteries from Asia ahead of President Donald Trump’s tariffs, giving the company a measure of insurance against the upheaval in trade policy now pressuring the automotive supply chain.

title: Brazil Denies Plans for Red Soccer World Cup Jersey After Political Backlash
content: Brazil’s iconic yellow soccer jersey has become such a potent conservative political symbol that many leftists refuse to wear it. Now, rumors the team might don a different color with deep associations to the left at the 2026 World Cup are inflaming the right.

title: Argentina’s Flagship Airline Won’t Be Subsidized for First Time Since 2008
content: Argentina’s flagship airline won’t need state subsidies for the first time since the government nationalized the company almost two decades ago, according to a press release Wednesday.

title: Ford to Delay Price Increases to See How Rivals React to Tariffs
content: Ford Motor Co. won’t increase the price of its vehicles until it sees how competing carmakers respond to higher costs imposed by President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: America Movil’s Profit Misses on Slowing Mexican Economy
content: Billionaire Carlos Slim’s wireless provider America Movil SAB missed net income projections for the first quarter after an economic slowdown in its two biggest markets led to more than a million prepaid subscribers disconnecting their service.

title: CDC Launches Team to Manage the Fallout From Deep Staff Cuts
content: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is creating a temporary strike force to manage the fallout of sweeping workforce cuts, according to an email obtained by Bloomberg News.

title: BlackRock-Backed Suez Taps HSBC to Review China Assets
content: Suez SA is reviewing its Chinese water infrastructure assets, people familiar with the matter said, as the French water utility looks at potential ways to streamline its global operations.

title: Spain’s Antitrust Agency Set to Clear BBVA’s Sabadell Bid
content: Spain’s antitrust agency approved with strict conditions BBVA SA’s €13 billion ($14.8 billion) bid to buy smaller rival Banco Sabadell SA, setting the stage for the government to have a final say in the year-long takeover fight, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: BBVA Hires Bankers Including L’Heureux in LevFin Shake-Up
content: BBVA SA has hired a trio of leveraged finance bankers, including Louis L’Heureux, into newly-created roles as Spain’s second-biggest bank looks to bulk up its presence and capabilities in the asset class.

title: JPMorgan Names Kresse Co-Head of Unit Catering to Silicon Valley
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. named Andrew Kresse to co-lead the innovation economy business in its commercial bank, a key growth area as the biggest US bank seeks to become the go-to firm for startups and their venture-capital backers.

title: Legislators propose upgraded tax credit for short line rail maintenance
content: New legislation would upgrade a federal tax credit short line railroads depend on for infrastructure spending.

title: Subscription scams surge across hundreds of fake websites - how to stay safe
content: Subscription scams are popping up on social media sites, attempting to trick users out of their credit card information.

title: Trump praises Gov. Gretchen Whitmer while at Michigan air base
content: Trump announced a new series of fighter jets for the Selfridge Air National Guard base in Michigan, giving credit in part to Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.

title: Can't make your credit card payments this May? Here's what to do.
content: At risk of falling behind on your credit card bills this May? Here's what to do before your debt and fees spiral.

title: Best Credit Cards for Cashback & Rewards in 2025 [Expert Picks]
content: In this guide, we break down the best credit cards for cashback and rewards in 2025, handpicked for U.S. consumers looking to get the most out of every dollar

content: If you are wondering how to improve your credit score fast, the key lies in taking targeted actions that have immediate impact. Start by paying off

title: ‘King of All Pimps’ — who recruited then-NY Gov. Eliot Spitzer hooker Ashley Dupré — claims his reputation was trashed by murder claim
content: A notorious pimp who took credit for recruiting Ashley Dupré, the hooker whose tryst with then-Gov. Eliot Spitzer ended the "Luv Guv's" career, claims in a lawsuit that a YouTuber has ruined his rep.

content: Falling behind on car payments can lead to repossession and long-term credit damage

title: How to prepare for credit card debt forgiveness this May
content: Credit card debt forgiveness can offer cardholders in debt critical help. Here's how to prepare this May.

title: $15 Amazon credit, $730 Apple Watch Ultra 2, $20 Kasa security cam, $119 Bose speaker, more
content: The hottest daily deals on Thursday include the Apple Watch Ultra 2, Kasa security cameras from TP-Link, Bose speakers, and more.

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content:

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today voted to end its defense of the rules requiring disclosure of climate-related risks and greenhouse gas emissions.

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the agenda and panelists for the March 27 roundtable on artificial intelligence in the financial industry.

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed settled charges against registered investment adviser Momentum Advisors LLC, its former managing partner Allan J. Boomer, and its former chief operating officer and partner Tiffany L. Hawkins, for…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that its Division of Corporation Finance is further facilitating capital formation by enhancing the accommodations available to companies for nonpublic review of draft registration statements.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that the Commission has filed a joint stipulation with Coinbase Inc. and Coinbase Global Inc. to dismiss the ongoing civil enforcement action against the two entities.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Stocks Climb as China Weighs Trade Talks With US: Markets Wrap
content: A global rally in stocks gained momentum after China said it’s evaluating trade talks with the US, boosting optimism that tariff tensions will tamp down.

Vedanta CFO on Zambia Copper IPO

Ajay Goel, CFO, Vedanta limited, says it is hard to give a timeline definitely, but it’s under active consideration.
He spoke with Haslinda Amin in an exclusive interview on "Insight with Haslinda Amin" (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/02/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Taiwan’s Currency, Stocks Surge on Hopes of Better US-China Ties
content: Taiwan’s currency and stocks surged on signs trade tensions between the world’s top two economies may start easing and as US tech earnings boosted the outlook of the island’s semiconductor exports.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/2/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Here’s What Traders Are Watching as US-India Trade Talks Advance
content: As India moves closer to clinching a trade deal with the US, traders are trying to gauge the potential impact on companies that make everything from cholesterol-lowering generic drugs to bed linen sold in Walmart Inc’s mega stores.

title: Vedanta Weighs Zambia Copper IPO to Fund $1 Billion Investment
content: Vedanta Resources, the mining and energy company controlled by Indian billionaire Anil Agarwal, is considering listing its Zambian copper unit to raise the funds it needs to invest in the asset.

title: Indian Bonds Hit by Worst Outflow Since JPMorgan Index Inclusion
content: Foreign funds cut their holdings of India’s index-eligible sovereign bonds by the most in a year, making it the biggest outflow after the nation’s debt joined a JPMorgan Chase & Co. gauge in June.

title: Murphy: President Wants to Make More in America, So Do I
content: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy is in the UAE for investment and trade talks. Speaking to Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche, the governor discussed the US trade policy, his thoughts on President Trump, and what lies next for him. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Do Not Rely on Chinese AI: Lux Capital's Josh Wolfe
content: Lux Capital's Co-Founder and Managing Partner Josh Wolfe speaks with Bloomberg's Annmarie Hordern on the sidelines of the Hill and Valley Forum in Washington, D.C. Wolfe talks about why the rest of the world should not rely on Chinese AI models, even as DeepSeek's technology disrupts the AI sector. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Best Is Over for US Stocks, Says Wood
content: US stock market reached an all-time peak in December 2024, and will never reach those highs again, says Christopher Wood, Global Head of Equity Strategy at Jefferies. Instead, investors should buy European, Chinese, Japanese, and Indian equities. Woods spoke on “The Pulse with Francine Lacqua” on Bloomberg TV.

title: S&P 500 Logs Eight Consecutive Positive Days
content: The S&P 500 has gained for eight consecutive days, its longest run since August. This comes amid increased optimism that trade tensions may be waning since US President Donald Trump announced new levies on April 2. Bloomberg's Valerie Tytel breaks down the situation.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Climbs as Traders Parse Trade-War Signals Before OPEC+ Meets
content: Oil rose, paring a steep weekly loss, as traders weighed the possibility of US-China trade talks and a fresh sanctions threat against Iranian flows against a potential supply hike from OPEC+.

title: China, US May Inch Closer to Talks After Trump Tariffs
content: China's announcement that it is evaluating the possibility of trade talks with the US has likely been endorsed at the highest levels of leadership, according to Professor John Gong from Beijing's University of International Business and Economics. The recent statement from China’s Commerce Ministry marks the first indication of a possible thaw in relations since Donald Trump increased tariffs last month. Professor Gong speaks on Bloomberg's The China Show. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Markets Can’t See a Recession Through the Tariffs
content: In all this confusion, a clearcut indicator isn’t ringing the alarm bells it should.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/02/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, David Ingles and Rebecca Choong Wilkins give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: How Trump's Team is Living Up to China's Media Narrative
content: Chinese propaganda has long portrayed the US as a global hegemon. According to China Media Monitor's David Bandurski, President Trump's administration is now "almost embracing" that role. The veteran China media watcher speaks with David Ingles and Rebecca Choong Wilkins on "Bloomberg: The China Show." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Growing Chorus Singing Nuclear Power’s Praises
content: Not long ago, it was seen as too slow, too expensive and too controversial to play a major role in the future energy mix. Not anymore.

title: Romania Politics Set to Stoke EU’s Highest Bond Yields For Now
content: Romania faces a prolonged period of elevated funding costs as a contentious presidential election risks further delaying steps to curb the European Union’s widest budget deficit.

title: AmCham Japan Chairman on US-Japan Trade Talks
content: Christopher LaFleur, Chairman at the American Chamber of Commerce in Japan, discusses the latest developments from the US and Japan's trade negotiations. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Metricon CEO on Australia Property, Elections
content: Brad Duggan, CEO at Metricon, discusses the outlook for Australia's property sector ahead of the country's federal election. He speaks with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Shery Ahn on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Foreign Funds Sour on US Corporate Bonds as Trump Sows Chaos
content: European and Asian money managers are showing signs of losing some of their appetite for lending to US companies as trade wars heat up, in a potentially worrying sign for corporate America.

title: Gold Road Halts Trading Due to Speculation Over Transaction
content: Gold Road Resources Ltd. shares were suspended from trading in Sydney, with the miner citing “media speculation regarding a potential change of control transaction”.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 5/2/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Pop Mart Holder Sells $97 Million Stake on Heels of Other Sale
content: An investor in Pop Mart International Group Ltd., whose fans include K-pop band Blackpink’s Lisa, raised $97 million by selling the stock soon after another sale of the Chinese toy company’s shares earlier this week.

title: India’s Top Bond Fund Says Rally Is Peaking Despite Dovish Mood
content: For one of India’s top-performing fund managers with a sense of history, the rally in the nation’s sovereign bond market is in its final stretches.

title: Mark Mobius Says His Fund Holds 95% in Cash on Trade War Risks
content: Veteran emerging-markets investor Mark Mobius is keeping the bulk of his funds’ holdings in cash as he waits out the trade-related uncertainty, which is likely to persist for up to six months.

title: Copper Rises as China Says It’s Weighing Trade Talks With US
content: Copper rose after China said it was evaluating having trade talks with the US, raising optimism that negotiations could reduce tariffs between the two largest economies.

title: Blue Owl-Owned Stack Seeks $833 Million Loan for Asia Growth
content: Blue Owl Capital-owned data center operator Stack Infrastructure Inc. is seeking an about A$1.3 billion ($833 million) loan, according to people familiar with the matter, as demand for artificial intelligence and cloud services accelerates in Asia.

title: US Seeks to Stop India-Pakistan Tensions Sparking Wider Conflict
content: Vice President JD Vance said the US was working to ensure tensions between India and Pakistan don’t escalate into a broader regional conflict in the wake of an attack last week that killed dozens of people in Indian-controlled Kashmir.

title: Nigel Farage’s Reform Wins Open UK Seat in Blow to Starmer
content: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK won a key parliamentary by-election following a recount, in a blow to Prime Minister Keir Starmer, fueling concerns in his Labour Party that he’s failing to slow the rise of the populist right.

title: AfDB President Candidate Advocates Tapping Middle East Finance
content: The African Development Bank should do more to tap finance from oil-rich Middle Eastern nations and access the money held by pension funds on the continent as development needs grow, a contender for the institution’s presidency said.

title: Trump Signs Executive Order to End Federal Funding of NPR, PBS
content: President Donald Trump ordered an end to taxpayer subsidies for National Public Radio and the Public Broadcasting Service, a longstanding goal of some Republicans who have accused the media outlets of bias.

title: China Shipping Loophole Closed by Trump, Raising Prices for US Consumers
content: Small-value packages shipped to the US from China will no longer be exempted from tariffs starting Friday, when President Donald Trump’s move against an exception he called a “big scam” takes effect.

title: Romania’s Revote Will Judge 30 Years of Graft
content: Traditional parties won’t be able to blame Russia. They failed.

title: Thai Prosecutors Drop Royal Insult Case Against US Academic
content: Thai prosecutors dismissed charges against an American academic accused of insulting the country’s monarchy, after his arrest was criticized by the US and cast a shadow over tariff talks.

title: China Says It’s Assessing US Talks, Hinting at Possible Thaw
content: China said it is assessing the possibility of trade talks with the US, the first sign since Donald Trump hiked tariffs last month that negotiations could begin between the two sides.

title: Duterte Lawyers Ask ICC to Throw Out Case, Order His Release
content: Lawyers of detained former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte have asked the International Criminal Court’s pre-trial chamber to nullify his case and order his release.

title: Runcorn By-Election on a Knife-Edge as Recount Takes Place
content: Nigel Farage's Reform UK could be on the brink of inflicting defeat on Labour in the first by-election test for Sir Keir Starmer.

title: S. Korea’s Han Looks to Rally Conservatives in Election Bid
content: South Korea’s former Acting President Han Duck-soo has entered the fray for the country’s top office, amid a flurry of leadership changes as the nation prepares for its June 3 presidential election.

title: Trump Budget Seeks 23% Domestic Spending Cut, 13% Defense Hike
content: President Donald Trump is asking Congress for deep cuts to domestic agencies and a boost to the military in a preliminary outline of his 2026 budget request to be released Friday.

title: Trump Plans Record $1.01 Trillion National Security Budget
content: President Donald Trump will request a record $1.01 trillion in national security spending for the fiscal year beginning Oct. 1, more than 13% over the current year’s figure, according to administration officials familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Moves to Cut Iran’s Oil Sales as Nuclear Talks Stall
content: President Donald Trump said he would impose secondary sanctions on nations or companies buying Iranian oil, ratcheting up pressure on Tehran as nuclear talks with the US hit a snag.

title: Photo Shows Trump Team Still Using Signal Despite Controversy
content: President Donald Trump recently suggested he’d rather his administration didn’t use the Signal messaging app. A recent photo suggests his team isn’t getting the message.

title: GOP Plans Billions in Oil, Gas Sales to Help Pay for Trump’s Tax Bill
content: House Republicans plan to raise more than $15 billion in revenue through increasing US oil, gas and coal lease sales, as well as other measures, to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive tax cut package, according to a document seen by Bloomberg News.

title: Supreme Court’s Jackson Blasts ‘Relentless Attacks’ on Judges
content: US Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson denounced what she called “relentless attacks” on the federal judiciary, saying efforts to intimidate judges were threatening the Constitution and the rule of law.

title: FCC’s Simington Seeks to Cap TV Networks’ Share of Local Revenue
content: Nathan Simington, a Republican member of the Federal Communications Commission, proposed capping the share of revenue that TV networks can collect from local stations, saying he wants to “rein in corporate media monopolies.”

title: Trump Deportations Under Wartime Law Blocked by US Judge
content: A federal judge in Texas ruled that President Donald Trump improperly invoked a 227-year-old wartime law to deport accused Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador prison, setting up what may become another high-stakes battle at the US Supreme Court.

title: UK Sickness Welfare Surge Not Due to Hospital Waits, Study Finds
content: Britain’s ballooning welfare benefits bill has not been caused by the surge in hospital waiting lists since the pandemic, according to research by the Institute for Fiscal Studies that challenges current official assumptions.

title: Adani Group Gets Modi’s Blessing as It Expands Mega India Port
content: India Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to kick off the second phase of Adani Group’s mega port in Kerala on Friday, showcasing the solid political support for billionaire Gautam Adani amid an ongoing bribery probe in the US.

title: What Musk’s 100 Days Mean for America
content: In Elon’s 100-Day Bet, Bloomberg Originals explores what the Tesla CEO leaves behind now that he says he’s stepping back from the Trump administration.

title: Why a Judge Rejected Trump’s Use of the Alien Enemies Act
content: When President Donald Trump in March ordered the immediate deportation of potentially thousands of alleged Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador mega-prison, he did so by invoking a controversial 227-year-old US law intended for use in times of war.

title: Trump Sidelines National Security Adviser With UN Job Swap
content: President Donald Trump said he will nominate Michael Waltz, his current national security adviser, to be the next US ambassador to the UN, sidelining a top aide who drew a wave of criticism for inadvertently adding a journalist to a Signal group chat where officials discussed sensitive attack plans.

title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Banker Asks US to Drop Foreign Bribery Case
content: A lawyer for a former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker told a federal judge that he has asked the US to drop its foreign bribery case, citing an executive order from President Donald Trump.

title: Noem Asks Supreme Court to Allow Lifting of Migrant Protections
content: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court for clearance to end legal protections that let 350,000 Venezuelans temporarily live and work in the country without risk of deportation.

title: Florida Immigration Raids Net 1,120 Arrests in Record Operation
content: Federal immigration agents working with state and local authorities arrested 1,120 people across Florida last week in what officials called the largest coordinated immigration enforcement operation ever conducted in the state.

title: Republicans Grind Out Details on Medicaid, SALT in Trump Tax Cut Plan
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson outlines where things stand with the Republican tax cut plan. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump Team Sees Ukraine Pact as Model for Future Foreign Deals
content: The Trump administration sees its resource deal with Ukraine as a model for further international agreements, reflecting the president’s strategy of using Washington’s foreign policy heft to secure assets and investment returns overseas.

title: Colombia’s Petro Presents Bill to Submit Labor Law to Referendum
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro presented a bill on Thursday that seeks to submit proposals for labor rights and working conditions to a public referendum after Congress rejected his labor reform earlier this year.

title: StanChart CFO on Earnings, Trade, Cost Reduction Program
content: Standard Chartered Plc. Chief Financial Officer Diego De Giorgi discusses the lender's performance in the first quarter as it beat estimates, largely driven by the bank’s wealth and financial markets units. He also talks about trade uncertainty, and the London-based lender's plan to return at least $8 billion to shareholders from 2024 to 2026. De Giorgi speaks in an interview on Bloomberg Television with Bloomberg's Tom Mackenzie. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Point72 Macro Portfolio Managers Ng and Blanchard Leave Firm
content: Point72 Asset Management macro portfolio manager Yau Ng has retired from the nearly $37 billion hedge fund giant after more than six years, said people with knowledge of the matter.

content: If Britain is going to wean itself off pig and chicken meat imports, producers argue output should rise. But locals disagree.

title: Australia Election: What's At Stake
content:
Australians will soon vote in a national election that's been dominated by cost of living concerns, but also hasn't escaped the shadow of Donald Trump's trade war.

Here's what is on the ballot. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Election Countdown Begins as Albanese Seeks a Second Term
content: Good morning, it’s Amy in Melbourne with your election eve newsletter. Today’s must-reads:• Opposition releases policy costings • Billionaire pledges money for Trump• Test looms for banking stocks

title: Harris Condemns Trump, Skips Governor Talk In Reemergence Speech
content: Questions on her potential run for California office were left hanging

title: Hegseth Should Be Fired: Sen. Coons
content: Senator Chris Coons says he thinks Pete Hegseth is who should be fired after "Signalgate." In an interview on "Balance of Power," Senator Coons tells Kailey Leinz and Joe Mathieu he's willing to vote "no" for the nomination of Mike Waltz for UN ambassador, but will keep an open mind.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Temu Ditches Chinese Imports Model to Avoid Trump’s Tariffs
content: Temu is abandoning the model centered around cheap Chinese imports that catapulted it to success in the US, aiming to sell only goods from local merchants to American consumers for the foreseeable future.

title: OpenAI Can’t Dodge Musk’s Fraud Claims in Restructuring Suit
content: A judge narrowed claims in Elon Musk’s lawsuit alleging that OpenAI broke its promise to function as a public charity by making plans to transform itself into a for-profit business.

title: What’s the De Minimis Tariff Loophole That Trump Has Closed?
content: A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to close a tariff loophole for “de minimis” merchandise from mainland China and Hong Kong from May 2.

title: Toyota, Nintendo Face Tariff Risk: Asia Earnings Week Ahead
content: Toyota Motor Corp. kicks off Japanese automotive earnings on the heels of President Donald Trump signing directives this week that eased the worst investor fears about US tariffs.

title: Blue Owl-Owned Stack Seeks $833 Million Loan for Asia Growth
content: Blue Owl Capital-owned data center operator Stack Infrastructure Inc. is seeking an about A$1.3 billion ($833 million) loan, according to people familiar with the matter, as demand for artificial intelligence and cloud services accelerates in Asia.

title: Prosecutors May Widen Charges in Singapore Nvidia Fraud Case
content: Singaporean prosecutors secured eight more weeks to deepen a probe and potentially bring more charges against three men accused of fraud in shipping servers likely containing Nvidia Corp. chips banned from China.

title: Apple to Source Billions of US-Made Chips in Supply Chain Shift
content: Apple Inc. plans to source more than 19 billion chips from the US this year, part of a global supply chain shift to gradually lessen its reliance on China and elevate India for iPhone production.

title: Microsoft Raises Xbox and Game Prices, Citing Rising Costs
content: Microsoft Corp. is raising prices on its Xbox games, consoles and accessories amid broader uncertainty about how the ongoing trade war will impact supply chains and the gaming industry.

title: Apple Renews Fears About Tariffs, China Slump With Wobbly Report
content: Apple Inc.’s much-awaited quarterly earnings report failed to soothe investor concerns about its biggest challenges, including escalating tariff costs and a slowdown in China.

title: Whole Foods Union Victory Upheld by US Labor Board Official
content: Whole Foods Market’s effort to overturn a unionization vote at a Philadelphia store was rejected by a US labor board official, a step towards requiring Amazon.com Inc.’s grocery chain to collectively bargain with US employees for the first time.

title: Block Shares Sink After Payments Company Cuts Profit Guidance
content: Shares of Block Inc. sank in late trading after the digital-payments company led by Jack Dorsey posted first-quarter results below analysts’ estimates and lowered its full-year profit guidance as a result of a more challenging macroeconomic environment.

title: Amazon Braces for Tougher Business Climate Amid Trump Trade War
content: Amazon.com Inc. said it’s bracing for a tougher business climate in the coming months, echoing concerns from a range of companies that tariffs and related economic turmoil could crimp consumer spending.

title: CIA Boosts Social Media Campaign to Recruit Chinese Officials
content: The Central Intelligence Agency released two videos Thursday aimed at recruiting Chinese officials who might be disillusioned by their prospects in government in a bid to get them to share top secrets about China with the US.

title: Apple’s Sales to Rise in ‘Low to Mid-Single Digit’ Percent Range
content: Apple Inc. said it expects revenue in the current period to grow in the “low- to mid-single digit” percentage range from a year earlier.

title: Apple Says Tariffs Will Add $900 Million in Costs This Quarter
content: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said that planned US tariffs on foreign imports will add $900 million in costs in the current period.

title: Duolingo Boosts Outlook as AI Drives Top-Tier Subscriptions
content: Duolingo Inc. raised its full-year sales and profit outlook as artificial intelligence offerings drive users to its higher-priced subscriptions.

title: Reddit Surges After Posting Sales Beating Analyst Estimates
content: Reddit Inc. shares jumped after it said revenue in the current quarter will be better than estimates, a sign that a broader dip in the economy hasn’t yet dented the digital advertising industry.

title: Harrods Is Latest UK Retailer to Battle Against Hacking Attacks
content: London’s luxury department store Harrods Ltd. reported hacking attempts Thursday, just days after two other UK retailers said they were attacked.

title: Instacart Gives Rosy Outlook After Best Order Growth Since 2022
content: Instacart posted its strongest order growth since 2022 for the first quarter and projected better-than-expected earnings for the current period, a sign of resilience in its core delivery business and growing grocery software and advertising unit.

title: Airbnb Gives Weak Outlook, Citing Softness in US Travel Demand
content: Airbnb Inc. issued a weak outlook for the second quarter, following online travel peer Booking Holdings Inc. in blaming economic uncertainties for softer travel demand in the US.

title: ‘60 Minutes’ to Air Story on Trump’s Targeting of Law Firms
content: Less than three weeks after President Donald Trump criticized 60 Minutes for what he said were too many critical stories, the newsmagazine announced plans to air a piece about his efforts to target law firms through executive orders.

title: The Danger of AI Chatbots Saying Exactly What You Want to Hear
content: OpenAI is taking steps to make ChatGPT less sycophantic, though the problem may be tough to solve completely. But first...

title: Microsoft, Meta Allay Tariff Fears; Apple Dealt a Blow | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Microsoft’s and Meta’s earnings beats. Plus, Carolina Milanesi, president and principal analyst at Creative Strategies, explains what investors are waiting to hear from Apple when the iPhone maker reports results. Andy McLoughlin, managing partner at Uncork Capital, also joins to talk about the firm's new $300 million fund and its search for the next big AI startup. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lightspeed Is Latest Firm to Shift Away From Classic VC Model
content: Lightspeed Venture Partners, one of Silicon Valley’s largest venture capital firms, has changed its regulatory status to broaden its range of investments — following similar moves by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz and General Catalyst as they shift away from the traditional VC playbook.

title: Trump-Tied Stablecoin Used for MGX’s $2 Billion Binance Deal
content: World Liberty Financial, the Trump family’s decentralized finance project, said its new stablecoin is being used for a $2 billion investment in crypto exchange Binance Holdings Ltd. by Abu Dhabi’s MGX.

title: Uber Launches Product for Seniors, With Rival Lyft Following Suit
content: Uber Technologies Inc. debuted a simpler version of its rideshare app to make it easier for older adults to get around, prompting rival Lyft Inc. to move up the launch announcement of a similar feature it had in the works.

title: Can Anyone Supplant Joe Rogan as the Most Popular Podcaster?
content: The comedian’s influential show has sat at No. 1 on the chart of the most popular podcasts in the US for over five years

title: Apple’s Chaotic Month Culminates in Tariff-Focused Earnings Test
content: Apple Inc. shares have clawed back a good portion of the ground they lost in the historic tariff-induced selloff last month, but that doesn’t mean investors are in the clear.

title: LinkedIn Shares Advertising Revenue With Creators In Video Push
content: LinkedIn will begin sharing advertising revenue with creators for the first time, as video content boosts the amount of time people spend on the site.

title: Ocado’s Total Bond Bill Set to Be Triple Last Year’s Amount
content: With Ocado Group Plc having wrapped up the sale of its latest bond, the company’s total annual interest bill is now close to £100 million ($133 million) — more than triple what it was paying this time last year.

title: Japan’s Kato Says US Treasury Holdings Could Be Negotiation Card
content: Japan’s Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said the country’s US Treasury holdings could be a card in its trade talks with Washington, referring to the largest stockpile of US debt held by a foreign nation.

content: A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to close a tariff loophole for “de minimis” merchandise from mainland China and Hong Kong from May 2.
