content: Small-value packages shipped to the US from China will no longer be exempted from tariffs starting Friday, when President Donald Trump’s move against an exception he called a “big scam” takes effect.

title: Romania Politics Set to Stoke EU’s Highest Bond Yields For Now
content: Romania faces a prolonged period of elevated funding costs as a contentious presidential election risks further delaying steps to curb the European Union’s widest budget deficit.

title: China Says It’s Assessing US Talks, Hinting at Possible Thaw
content: China said it is assessing the possibility of trade talks with the US, the first sign since Donald Trump hiked tariffs last month that negotiations could begin between the two sides.

title: Asia’s Factories Suffer Major Blow as Trump’s Tariffs Hit Demand
content: Manufacturing activity across most of Asia contracted in April, with companies struggling with weaker demand and pausing new orders in the face of US President Donald Trump’s baseline 10% tariff.

title: Japan Sees Trade Talks Speeding Up, Hopes for June Agreement
content: Japan aims to achieve a trade agreement with the US in June, with the high-stakes bilateral discussions expected to gain momentum in mid-May, Tokyo’s chief negotiator said after concluding the latest round of talks in Washington.

title: Australian Retail Sales Climb for Third Straight Month in March
content: Australian retail sales rose for a third straight month, reflecting a recent pickup in consumer spending and suggesting the economy was in reasonable shape before US tariffs set off a wave of volatility across global markets.

title: Japan’s Job Market Stays Tight, Supporting Wage Momentum
content: Japan’s labor market remained largely tight in March, supporting momentum for wage hikes, while uncertainties over the global trade war continue to darken the outlook.

title: South Korea’s Steady Inflation Gives BOK Scope to Cut Rates
content: South Korea’s consumer prices rose at the same pace in April, giving the central bank scope to consider resuming the rate-cut cycle at its policy meeting later this month.

title: UK Sickness Welfare Surge Not Due to Hospital Waits, Study Finds
content: Britain’s ballooning welfare benefits bill has not been caused by the surge in hospital waiting lists since the pandemic, according to research by the Institute for Fiscal Studies that challenges current official assumptions.

title: US Hiring Seen Slowing, With Brunt of Tariff Impact Coming Later
content: US employment growth probably decelerated in April and the jobless rate held steady, illustrating healthy yet moderating labor demand entering a period when trade policy risks chilling the hiring decisions.

title: US Jobless Claims by Federal Employees Have Declined After Spike
content: New applications for unemployment benefits filed by federal employees have been largely flat in the past five weeks after a brief spike when the Trump administration started to fire workers across agencies.

title: Port Leaders Warn Tariffs Bring ‘Radical Uncertainty’ to Economy
content: Leaders of major West Coast ports warned that a sharp drop in ship traffic tied to President Donald Trump’s steep tariffs on Chinese goods will threaten jobs, raise prices and ripple through the broader US economy.

title: Summers Says Wrong to Say Markets Tell Fed It Should Cut
content: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said that bond-market pricing doesn’t amount to a judgment call on what the Federal Reserve ought to do with interest rates, and that it would be a “very serious error” for policymakers to ease next week.

title: US Toymakers Scramble to Adjust to Trump’s China Tariffs
content: America’s toymakers outsourced manufacturing to China in the 1980s to cut costs. Nearly half a century later, that decision could bankrupt them.

title: Yen Slides as Bank of Japan Pours Cold Water on Rate Hikes
content: The yen fell sharply against the dollar after the Bank of Japan said it will take longer than it previously thought to hit the inflation target, leading traders to pare bets on further interest-rate hikes.

title: Peruvian Inflation Accelerated More Than Expected in April
content: Inflation in Peru’s capital rose faster than expected in April, but remains comfortably within the central bank’s target band.

title: US Manufacturing Activity Shrinks by the Most Since November
content: US manufacturing activity shrank in April by the most in five months as lean order books and the repercussions from tariffs prompted the steepest output contraction since 2020.

title: US Jobless Claims Jump on Spike in New York During Spring Recess
content: Applications for US unemployment benefits rose to the highest level since February during the week that followed Easter and spring recess at New York City public schools.

title: Trump’s Effort to Blame Biden for Economy Ignores Tariff Fallout
content: President Donald Trump has started vacillating between telling Americans to be patient in the face of bad economic news and blaming his predecessor for it, leaving him vulnerable to losing the support of voters who elected him to improve the nation’s economy.

title: Traders Fully Price Four More BOE Quarter-Point Cuts This Year
content: Traders boosted wagers on Bank of England policymakers speeding up the pace of interest-rate cuts as concerns grow that weakness in the US economy may spread globally.

title: EU to Present Trade Proposals to US Negotiators Next Week
content: The European Union is planning to share a paper with the US next week that will set out a package of proposals to kick-start trade negotiations with the Trump administration.

title: Europe Is Set to Test Trump’s Bandwidth to Discuss Trade
content: With just over 60 days to go until President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs are set to snap into force, the race to do trade deals with the US is expanding beyond a few export powers in Asia.

title: Trade Has a Recent History of Dragging US GDP Down
content: I’m Ben Holland, an economics editor in Washington. Today we’re looking at trade and GDP. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Yellen Warns US Recession Risk Is ‘Way Up’ After Trump’s Tariffs
content: Janet Yellen warned that the risk of a US recession has “gone way up” after Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs rattled financial markets, consumers and businesses.

title: UK Mortgage Approvals Dip as Time Ran Out to Beat Tax Hike
content: UK mortgage approvals fell for a third month in March as house hunters ran out of time to tie up purchases before a property transaction tax went up at the start of April.

title: Bank of Japan Pushes Back Inflation Target Due to Trade War
content: The Bank of Japan pushed back the timing for when it expects to reach its inflation target and slashed its growth forecasts as the global trade war initiated by US President Donald Trump darkens the economic outlook.

title: Russia Triples 2025 Deficit Target With Less Energy Income Seen
content: The Russian Finance Ministry more than tripled its budget deficit target for this year after expectations for revenue and the price of oil were reduced amid US President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Musk Says DOGE Should Examine Federal Reserve Renovation Costs
content: Billionaire Elon Musk said he is considering sending his government efficiency team to the Federal Reserve, citing a costly renovation of the central bank’s Washington, DC, headquarters as an example of potential government waste.

title: StanChart Traders Ride Volatility to Lift Quarterly Profit
content: Standard Chartered Plc reported first-quarter profit that topped analyst expectations as the firm’s traders benefited from the market volatility wrought by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: BASF Warns It Needs More Time to Assess Tariff Impact on Outlook
content: BASF SE warned that uncertainty caused by President Donald Trump’s trade tactics means it can’t make reliable predictions for its business this year.

title: Shell Sticks With Payouts, Spending Plans Despite Oil’s Drop
content: Shell Plc stuck to its plans for investor returns and capital spending, taking on extra debt to fill the gap in its cash flow stemming from the drop in oil prices.

title: Vedanta Weighs Zambia Copper IPO to Fund $1 Billion Investment
content: Vedanta Resources, the mining and energy company controlled by Indian billionaire Anil Agarwal, is considering listing its Zambian copper unit to raise the funds it needs to invest in the asset.

title: NatWest Says Full-Year Income Set to Hit Upper End of Guidance
content: NatWest Group Plc beat estimates in the first quarter and pointed to improving earnings this year as the bank’s customers proved resilient to the unfolding strains on the global economy.

title: Philippines $3.5 Billion Subway No Longer Feasible, Builder Says
content: A $3.5-billion subway project in the Philippines’ main financial hub is no longer feasible following an inter-city dispute, according to its developer on Friday.

title: Dangote Reiterates $30 Billion Revenue Target Despite US Tariff
content: Aliko Dangote, Africa’s richest person, said his group is on track to generate total revenue of $30 billion next year, even as companies fret over the potential impact of US President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Danske Bank Confirms 2025 Guidance as NII Beats Forecasts
content: Danske Bank A/S, the largest lender in Denmark, confirmed its full-year guidance following a solid first quarter, driven by better-than-expected net interest income and strong credit quality.

title: ING Unveils Buyback But Pushes Out Capital Goal Amid Tariffs
content: ING Groep NV announced a fresh buyback of €2 billion while giving itself more time to draw down capital.

title: Factories Key to Trump’s ‘Golden Age’ Urge China Tariff Relief
content: Almost as swiftly as he has erected his tariff wall around the US over the past 100 days, President Donald Trump has issued exemptions for a select but growing family of products like auto parts and smartphones.

title: Gold Road Halts Trading Due to Speculation Over Transaction
content: Gold Road Resources Ltd. shares were suspended from trading in Sydney, with the miner citing “media speculation regarding a potential change of control transaction”.

title: Norway’s Equinor Offloads Stake in Brazilian Oil Field for $3.5 Billion
content: Norwegian energy explorer Equinor ASA has agreed to sell its 60% stake in the Peregrino oil and gas project off the Brazilian coast for $3.5 billion, it said in a statement.

title: Kohl’s Fires CEO for Directing Millions to Romantic Partner
content: Kohl’s Corp. said it fired its chief executive officer only months into his tenure after the board uncovered that he directed millions of dollars of business to someone he has had a personal relationship with that wasn’t disclosed.

title: HSBC Investors With $1.6 Trillion Seek Reassurance on Net Zero
content: A group of 30 HSBC Holdings Plc investors is asking the bank to confirm it’s still committed to cutting CO2 emissions, amid concerns Europe’s biggest lender is backing away from its climate pledges.

title: Obesity Drug Price Wars Heat Up as CVS Picks Novo Over Lilly
content: The obesity drug price wars are finally starting.

title: US Claims Medicare Insurers, Brokers Used Illegal Kickbacks
content: The US sued top health insurance companies and brokers, alleging they used illegal kickbacks to steer members into certain private Medicare Advantage plans.

title: Frontier to Cut Capacity, Outlays to Save Extra $300 Million
content: Frontier Group Holdings, Inc. said it plans to reduce capacity through November and cut spending to save at least $300 million more than prior expectations.

title: CN Railway Defies Tariff Gloom, Keeps 2025 Growth Outlook
content: Canadian National Railway Co. kept its financial outlook for 2025 intact despite rising economic risks, but management acknowledged that uncertainty is leaving many customers in limbo.

title: JAB Seeks $2.5 Billion for Keurig Dr Pepper Share Block
content: JAB Holding Co. is seeking to raise as much as $2.5 billion from the sale of Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. shares, according to people familiar with the matter, as it continues to sell down its holdings of the beverage company.

title: Xcel CEO Says AI Power Needs Raise Prospect of New Large Nuclear
content: It’s been more than a decade since the US last broke ground on a large-scale nuclear power plant that came online. Xcel Chief Executive Officer Bob Frenzel is raising the idea that it’s time to start again.

title: AIG Investment Gains Help First-Quarter Profit Top Estimates
content: American International Group Inc.’s investment income gains helped the insurer’s operating profit beat analysts’ estimates, in a period otherwise marked by extraordinary losses from the Los Angeles wildfires.

title: Whirlpool’s Ratings Cut to Junk by S&P Amid Revenue Pressure
content: Whirlpool Corp., the owner of the KitchenAid and Maytag brands, was cut to junk status by S&P Global Ratings, which cited the company’s high debt levels and potential pressure on revenue as tariffs ramp up.

title: Tesla Board in Spotlight After Cashing In $1.2 Billion With Musk
content: Almost like clockwork since mid-November, Tesla Inc. board chair Robyn Denholm has been selling the company’s stock. During that time, shares whipsawed and the company’s sales slowed — and then cratered — around the world.

title: Eli Lilly’s Shares Sink on Investor Concerns About CVS Move
content: Eli Lilly & Co.’s shares saw the biggest one-day drop since 2008 after CVS Health Corp. announced a plan to drop its blockbuster weight-loss drug Zepbound from its preferred list, making rival Wegovy more widely available.

title: Amgen Beats on Profit as Obesity Drug Moves Toward Market
content: Amgen Inc. outperformed Wall Street’s quarterly profit estimates as it moves forward with plans to crack the multibillion-dollar market for novel weight-loss medicines.

title: American Airlines Agrees to $4 Billion Dallas Airport Expansion
content: Dallas Fort Worth International Airport and American Airlines Group Inc. reached an agreement on a $4 billion expansion project.

title: CVS Drops Lilly’s Zepbound as Preferred Drug in Win for Novo
content: CVS Health Corp.’s drug-benefits unit negotiated a deal to make Novo Nordisk A/S’s Wegovy more widely available to its members, a blow to rival Eli Lilly & Co.’s Zepbound that was moved off the company’s list of preferred drugs.

title: Multistrategy Hedge Funds Turn a Rocky April Into More Gains
content: Some of the biggest multistrategy hedge funds turned a wild April into steady gains as they navigated sharp volatility amid Donald Trump’s tariff announcements and pauses.

title: Delta’s Endeavor Regional Airline Chief Executive to Step Down
content: Delta Air Lines Inc. says the head of its Endeavor Air regional carrier will step down, but remain with the parent company.

title: College That Sold Georgia O’Keeffe Art Cut to Junk by Moody’s
content: Valparaiso University, a Lutheran school in Indiana struggling to enroll more students, was downgraded two notches to junk by Moody’s Ratings.

title: Elon Musk, DOGE team credit fed workers for helping trim waste, fraud
content: Elon Musk and his DOGE team expressed their gratitude Thursday to the federal employees partnering with the cost-cutting agency as they work around the clock to eliminate wasteful spending and modernize the workforce.

title: Legislators propose upgraded tax credit for short line rail maintenance
content: New legislation would upgrade a federal tax credit short line railroads depend on for infrastructure spending.

title: Subscription scams surge across hundreds of fake websites - how to stay safe
content: Subscription scams are popping up on social media sites, attempting to trick users out of their credit card information.

title: Trump praises Gov. Gretchen Whitmer while at Michigan air base
content: Trump announced a new series of fighter jets for the Selfridge Air National Guard base in Michigan, giving credit in part to Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.

title: Can't make your credit card payments this May? Here's what to do.
content: At risk of falling behind on your credit card bills this May? Here's what to do before your debt and fees spiral.

title: Best Credit Cards for Cashback & Rewards in 2025 [Expert Picks]
content: In this guide, we break down the best credit cards for cashback and rewards in 2025, handpicked for U.S. consumers looking to get the most out of every dollar

title: 7 Simple Steps to Improve Your Credit Score Fast
content: If you are wondering how to improve your credit score fast, the key lies in taking targeted actions that have immediate impact. Start by paying off

title: ‘King of All Pimps’ — who recruited then-NY Gov. Eliot Spitzer hooker Ashley Dupré — claims his reputation was trashed by murder claim
content: A notorious pimp who took credit for recruiting Ashley Dupré, the hooker whose tryst with then-Gov. Eliot Spitzer ended the "Luv Guv's" career, claims in a lawsuit that a YouTuber has ruined his rep.

title: The U.S. states where auto loan delinquency is rising the most
content: Falling behind on car payments can lead to repossession and long-term credit damage

title: How to prepare for credit card debt forgiveness this May
content: Credit card debt forgiveness can offer cardholders in debt critical help. Here's how to prepare this May.

title: China 'evaluating' US offer to talk tariffs; warns against 'extortion'

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Division of Economic and Risk Analysis (DERA) has published new data and analysis on the key market areas of public issuers, exempt offerings, Commercial Mortgage-Backed Securities (CMBS), Asset-Backed Securities…

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Ramil Palafox for orchestrating a fraudulent scheme that raised approximately $198 million from investors worldwide and for misappropriating more than $57 million of investor funds.

content:
Paul S. Atkins was sworn into office today as the 34th Chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Chairman Atkins was nominated by President Donald J. Trump on January 20, 2025, and confirmed by the U.S. Senate on April 9, 2025.

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced an award of approximately $6 million to joint whistleblowers who provided new information that led to the opening of an examination and provided a roadmap for an enforcement action that resulted in…

title: SEC Small Business Advisory Committee to Explore Regulation A
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Small Business Capital Formation Advisory Committee announced that its meeting on Tuesday, May 6, 2025, will focus on the practical market considerations and regulatory challenges of Regulation A. Members of the…

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Crypto Custody
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Crypto Task Force has announced the agenda and panelists for its April 25 roundtable, “Know Your Custodian: Key Considerations for Crypto Custody.”

title: SEC Extends Effective and Compliance Dates for Amendments to Investment Company Reporting Requirements
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a two-year extension of the effective and compliance dates for rule amendments adopted in August 2024 that require many types of registered funds to more frequently report portfolio-related…

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: SEC Publishes New Data and Analysis About Registered Investment Companies and Money Market Funds
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today published new data and analysis in a pair of reports that provide the investing public with updated key information about registered investment companies and money market funds.  

“It is important that…

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Crypto Trading
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Crypto Task Force has announced the agenda and panelists for its April 11 roundtable, “Between a Block and a Hard Place: Tailoring Regulation for Crypto Trading.”

“Hearing the public’s concerns and…

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC Charges Three Arizona Individuals with Defrauding Investors in $284 Million Municipal Bond Offering That Financed Sports Complex
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Randall “Randy” Miller, Chad Miller, and Jeffrey De Laveaga with creating false documents that were provided to investors in two municipal bond offerings that raised $284 million to build one of the…

title: SEC Votes to End Defense of Climate Disclosure Rules
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today voted to end its defense of the rules requiring disclosure of climate-related risks and greenhouse gas emissions.

SEC Acting Chairman Mark T. Uyeda said, “The goal of today’s Commission action and…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Four More Roundtables
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the agenda and panelists for the March 27 roundtable on artificial intelligence in the financial industry.  

“I look forward to hearing from the panelists on how emerging technologies,…

title: SEC Charges New Jersey Investment Adviser and His Firm with Fraud and Other Violations
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

title: SEC Extends Compliance Dates for Amendments to Investment Company Names Rule
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

title: SEC Charges Investment Adviser and Two Officers for Misuse of Fund and Portfolio Company Assets
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed settled charges against registered investment adviser Momentum Advisors LLC, its former managing partner Allan J. Boomer, and its former chief operating officer and partner Tiffany L. Hawkins, for…

title: Filer Transition to New and Improved EDGAR Begins March 24
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

title: SEC Staff Facilitates Capital Formation for Companies Planning Public Offerings
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that its Division of Corporation Finance is further facilitating capital formation by enhancing the accommodations available to companies for nonpublic review of draft registration statements.

In…

title: Commissioner Hester Peirce Announces Crypto Task Force Staff
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.



The task force is composed of staff from the Acting Chairman’s office and other divisions…

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: SEC Announces Dismissal of Civil Enforcement Action Against Coinbase
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that the Commission has filed a joint stipulation with Coinbase Inc. and Coinbase Global Inc. to dismiss the ongoing civil enforcement action against the two entities.

On January 21, 2025, the…

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
